bacalia: <entryFree id="n4774" type="hapax" key="ba_ca_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bācālĭa</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>baca</etym>, <sense id="n4774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of laurel abounding in berries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacalis: <entryFree id="n4775" type="main" key="ba_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bācālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing berries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bacalusia: <entryFree id="n4776" type="main" key="bacalusi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacalusĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sweetmeat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> (dub.; cf. Büchel. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
bacanal: <entryFree id="n4777" type="main" key="Baca_nal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacānal</orth>, v. Bacchanal <sense id="n4777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bacar: <entryFree id="n4778" type="gloss" key="bacar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacar</orth>, <sense id="n4778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine-vessel similar to the</hi> bacrio, <hi rend="ital">a wine-glass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> p. 344</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacatus: <entryFree id="n4779" type="main" key="ba_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bācātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of a verb not otherwise in use, <orth extent="full" lang="la">bāco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>baca, II. B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n4779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned with pearls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pearl</hi>- (very rare): monile, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 655</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacca: <entryFree id="n4780" type="main" key="bacca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacca</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">baccālis</orth>, etc., v. baca, bacalis, etc.</entryFree>
baccar: <entryFree id="n4781" type="greek" key="baccar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baccar</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bacchar</orth>), <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">baccăris</orth>,<pb n="218" /> <cb n="BACC" />  <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 45</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ba/kxa^ris</foreign>, <sense id="n4781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant having a fragrant root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which an oil was expressed;</hi> also called nardum rusticum (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 45</bibl>); acc. to Sprengel it is the Celtic valerian: Valeriana Celtica. Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 16, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 19</bibl> (baccar herba est, quae facinum depellit, Serv.); 7, 27.</sense></entryFree>
baccha: <entryFree id="n4782" type="main" key="Baccha1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baccha</orth> (old orthog. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Baca</orth>; v. S. C. Bacch.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacca</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 4</bibl> Wagn.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacche</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 41</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/kxh</foreign>; cf. also <foreign lang="greek">*maina/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*qui+a/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Bacchanet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female attendant of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in company with Silenus and the Satyrs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated the festival of that deity with a raving madness carried even to insensibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with an ivy crown upon her head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fawn-skin upon her left shoulder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a staff wound with ivy in her hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and with hair loose and flying wildly about</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=87" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 87</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 587</bibl> sq.; 9, 642; 11, 89; id. Tr. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:507" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 507</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 74</bibl> (Matres Edonides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 69</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Bacchus).—Represented in paintings: Bacchas istas cum Musis Metelli comparas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchis initiare aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to initiate into the festivals of Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 39, 10, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">39, 14, 8.—In a pun with Bacchis (q. v. II.): quia Bacchis, Bacchas metuo et Bacchanal tuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; v. Bacchis. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n4782.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/kxeios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">relating to the Bacchœ</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Bacchantes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchantian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:223" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <trans><tr>spilt by them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:328" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 791</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4783" type="gloss" key="Baccha2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baccha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of Spanish wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=87" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 87</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
bacchabundus: <entryFree id="n4784" type="main" key="baccha_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacchābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bacchor</etym>, <sense id="n4784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">revelling in the manner of the Bacchantes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boisterous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ranting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raving</hi> (post-Aug. and rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bacchans): agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 326, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchaeus: <entryFree id="n4785" type="main" key="Bacchaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchaeus</orth> = Baccheus, v. Bacchus, II. C.</entryFree>
bacchanal: <entryFree id="n4786" type="main" key="Baccha_nal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchānal</orth> (old orthog. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacānal</orth>, v. S. C. Bacch. A. V. C. 568, Wordsworth, Fragm. and Spec. p. 172: <orth extent="full" lang="la">baccānal</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 3</bibl>), <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from Bacchus, like Fagutal, Frutinal, Lupercal, etc.; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> 1</bibl> to the Pref.</etym>, <sense id="n4786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place devoted to Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the place where the festivals of Bacchus were celebrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">NE QVIS EORVM BACANAL HABVISE VELET, S. C. Bacch. v. 4: EA BACANALIA... IN DIEBVS X... FACIATIS VTEI DISMOTA SIENT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> v. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Baccas veni in Baccanal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchanalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4786.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchānālia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> sometimes Bacchananorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 79</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl default="NO"><author>Firm. Mat.</author> Err. Prof. Relig. 6, 9</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a feast of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the orgies of Bacchus</hi> (diff. from the Roman festival of Liber; v. Liberalia); celebrated once in three years, at night, and in the most tumultuous and licentious manner (cf. Smith, Antiq.); hence, prohibited in Rome, A.U.C. 568, B.C. 186, by a decree of the Senate, Senatusconsultum de Bacchanalibus, which is yet preserved (v. Wordsworth, Fragm. and Spec. p. 172 sq.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 16, 10</bibl>; 39, 18, 7 sq.; 39, 41, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 68</bibl>.—Rarely in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchanal facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 20</bibl>; so, exercere, id Suppos Amph Tun' me mactes? v. 12: habere, in the abovementioned S. C.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchanalia vivere,</quote> <trans><tr>to live in the manner of the Bacchantes</tr>, <tr>to live riotously and wantonly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchanalis: <entryFree id="n4787" type="main" key="Baccha_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchānālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Bacchus</etym>, <sense id="n4787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchanalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>, n. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">festum = Bacchanalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchar: <entryFree id="n4788" type="main" key="bacchar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacchar</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">bacchăris</orth>, v. baccar.</entryFree>
baccharia: <entryFree id="n4789" type="main" key="Baccharia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baccharia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a lost play of Plautus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchatim: <entryFree id="n4790" type="hapax" key="baccha_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacchātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>bacchor</etym>, <sense id="n4790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the manner of the Bacchœ</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Bacchantes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a riotous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanton manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchatio: <entryFree id="n4791" type="main" key="baccha_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacchātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n4791.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrating of the orgies of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 4" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>.—Hence. </sense><sense id="n4791.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A revelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of the Bacchœ</hi> (rare): sileatur de nocturnis ejus baccationibus ac vigiliis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 33</bibl>. <cb n="BACC" /></sense></entryFree>
baccheis: <entryFree id="n4792" type="main" key="Bacche_i^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchēĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <sense id="n4792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Bacchis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ancestor of the Corinthian Bacchiadœ;</hi> hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Corinthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephyres Baccheidos altum Culmen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Corinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
baccheius: <entryFree id="n4793" type="main" key="Bacche_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Bacchus, II. D.</entryFree>
baccheus: <entryFree id="n4794" type="main" key="Bacche_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchēus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n4794.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchic;</hi> v.1. Bacchus, II. C.—</sense><sense id="n4794.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bacchantian;</hi> v.1. Baccha <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bacchia: <entryFree id="n4795" type="gloss" key="bacchi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of drinking vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a goblet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowl</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchiadae: <entryFree id="n4796" type="main" key="Bacchi^a^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchĭădae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bakxia/dai</foreign>, <sense id="n4796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bacchiadœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a very ancient royal family of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descended from Bacchis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Heraclidœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">being expelled from the throne by Cypselus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wandered to Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founded Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 407</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 152</bibl> (cf. Aelian, V. H. 1, 19; Pausan. Corinth. p. 120; Strabo, 8, p. 260).</sense></entryFree>
bacchicus: <entryFree id="n4797" type="main" key="Bacchi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchĭcus</orth>, v. 1. Bacchus, II. A.</entryFree>
bacchilidium: <entryFree id="n4798" type="main" key="Bacchi^li^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchĭlĭdĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">metrum</orth>) <itype>constat dimetro</itype> (troch.) hypercatalecto, ut est hoc: <sense id="n4798.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">floribus corona texitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1819</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
bacchis: <entryFree id="n4799" type="main" key="Bacchis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bakxi/s</foreign>. <sense id="n4799.0" n="I" level="1"> = 1. Baccha, q. v.—</sense><sense id="n4799.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a woman in the</hi> Hec. and Heaut. <hi rend="ital">of Terence;</hi> and, in <number>plur.</number>, Bacchides, <hi rend="ital">the name of a comedy of Plautus</hi> (derived from the twin sisters, Bacchides, the chief personages of the piece): <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchides non Bacchides, set Bacchae sunt acerrumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchisonus: <entryFree id="n4800" type="hapax" key="Bacchi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Bacchussono</etym>, <sense id="n4800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Nat. XI. S. Fel. 281</bibl> Murat.</sense></entryFree>
bacchius: <entryFree id="n4801" type="main" key="Bacchi^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v.1. Bacchus, II. B.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n4802" type="main" key="Bacchi_us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v.1. Bacchus, II. E.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4803" type="main" key="Bacchi_us3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchīus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/kxeios</foreign>, <sense id="n4803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n4803.1" n="I" level="1"> Bacchius Milesius, <hi rend="ital">a writer on agriculture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4803.2" n="II" level="1"> (Scanned Bacchĭus.) <hi rend="ital">A gladiator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchor: <entryFree id="n4804" type="main" key="bacchor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacchor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n4804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pres. gen. plur.</hi> bacchantum; v. I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> infra), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>Bacchus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n4804.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate the festival of Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baccha bacchans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxea ut effigies bacchantis prospicit Evoe,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which cries Evoe in the orgies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:255" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 255</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bacchan-tes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Bacchae, <hi rend="ital">the Bacchantes</hi>: passis Medea capillis Bacchantum ritu, Ov.M. 7, 258; 3, 703; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 15</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Bacchantium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 10, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4804.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (as in later Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bakxeu/esqai, bakxeuqh=nai</foreign>) of the place in which the orgies of Bacchus were celebrated: <cit><quote lang="la">virginibus bacchata Lacaenis Taygeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 487</bibl></cit> Heyn.: <cit><quote lang="la">bacchata jugis Naxos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dindyma sanguineis famulum bacchata lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: ita obsoletum sono furenter ab omni parti bacchatur nemus, Santra ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 78, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ululatibus Ide bacchatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 206</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4804.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to revel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like the Bacchœ</hi> (of every species of mental excitement, love, hatred, joy, etc.; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in more elevated prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus gaudiis exsultabis? quantā in voluptate bacchabere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor in vestrā caede bacchantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:18:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 18, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego sanius Bacchabor Edonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; Col. poët. 10, 198; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 213</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 192</bibl>.—Of murderous fury: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā in illos caede bacchati sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 20, 25</bibl></cit>.—So of <usg type="style">poet.</usg> inspiration, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:258" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 258</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with carmen as object: grande Sophocleo carmen bacchamur hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:636" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 636</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">furebant Euhoe bacchantes,</quote> <trans><tr>raving to the cry of Euhoe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:61" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 61</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run about in a wanton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raving</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">furious manner</hi>: animans Omne, quod in magnis bacchatur montibu' passim, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 822</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevit inops animi, totamque incensa per urbem Bacchatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 301</bibl></cit> ( = discursitat, Heyne): <cit><quote lang="la">immanis in antro Bacchatur vates,</quote> <trans><tr>raves</tr>, <tr>is inspired</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 78</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 385: infelix virgo totā bacchatur in urbe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 166</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4804.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to be furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage with fury</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be impetuous</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n4804.5" n="1" level="3"> So of a vessel of wine that is filled very often: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi bacchabatur aula, casabant cadi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n4804.6" n="2" level="3"> Of winds: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracio bacchante magis sub interlunia vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 29</bibl>.—Of violent rain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6</bibl>, <cb n="BACC" /> 632.—</sense><sense id="n4804.7" n="3" level="3"> Of a rumor: concussam bacchatur fama per urbem, <hi rend="ital">spreads rapidly</hi>, Verg A. 4, 666.—</sense><sense id="n4804.8" n="4" level="3"> Of enthusiastic, raging discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eos, quorum altior oratio actioque esset ardentior furere et bacchari arbitraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:276" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 80, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosum dicendi genus, quod inanibus locis bacchatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchus: <entryFree id="n4805" type="main" key="Bacchus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/kxos</foreign>, <sense id="n4805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Jupiter and a Theban woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Semele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:485" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 485</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis genitus (since, as Semele died before his birth, he was carried about by Jupiter in his hip until the time of his maturity),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 12</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 310</bibl>, and bimatris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl>; v. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 26, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 521</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the god of wine</hi> (as such also called Liber, the deliverer, Lyæus (<foreign lang="greek">lu/ein</foreign>), the care-dispeller; cf. Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P., or Trag. Rel. v. 149 Vahl.; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:38" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 38</bibl>; as intoxicating and inspiring, he is <hi rend="ital">god of poets</hi>, esp. of the highly inspired, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:33 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 33 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">who wore crowns of ivy, which was consecrated to him,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: Bacchica verba (poëtae), id <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>.—He was worshipped esp. in Thrace and Macedonia, and particularly upon Mount Edon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, the Bacchæ are called matres Edonides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 42</bibl>; v. also Liber.—Bacchus, in the most ancient times, is represented as a god of nature by a Phallic Herma (v. such a statue in O. Müll. Denkm. 4); in the class. per. in the form of a beautiful youth (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:773" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 773</bibl>), with a crown of vine leaves or ivy upon his head, and sometimes with small horns upon his forehead (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:481" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 481</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 767</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 483</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">hence, corymbifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:393" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 393</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. cornua, p. 37 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">his soft hair fell in long ringlets upon his shoulders (depexus crinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:465" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 465</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 421</bibl>); with the exception of a fawn's skin (<foreign lang="greek">nebri/s</foreign>) thrown around him, he was usually represented naked, but with high and beautiful buskins, the Dionysian cothurni, upon his feet; in his hand he, as well as his attendants (a satyr, Silenus, and the Bacchæ), carried the thyrsus (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:764" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 764</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 7 sq.</bibl>); cf. O. Müll. Arch. § 383.—</sense><sense id="n4805.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4805.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The cry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invocation to Bacchus</hi>, lo Bacche! audito Baccho, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 302</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4805.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apertos Bacchus amat colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 38</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fertilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4805.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi quom flos evanuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madeant generoso pocula Baccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et multo in primis hilarans convivia Baccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 69</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 344</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 765</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 488</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 246</bibl>; 7, 450; 13, 639; cf.: Bacchi Massicus umor. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 143</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4805.5" n="II" level="1"> Hence, derivv. </sense><sense id="n4805.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bac-chĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bakxikos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:62" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:479" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naxos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 513</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n4805.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/kxios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 518</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4805.8" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/kxeios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ululatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>the feast of Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:691" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:435" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 435</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4805.9" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchēĭ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 454</bibl></cit> (prob. a spurious verse; v. Forbig. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n4805.10" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchic</hi>: pes, <hi rend="ital">a metrical foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Bacchius</hi>, ¯¯˘ <cit><quote lang="la">(e. g. Rōmānŭs),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2414" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2414</bibl></cit> P., although others reverse this order; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Div. in Caecil. 7" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7</bibl>; Don. p. 1739 P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4806" type="main" key="Bacchus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> myxon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 28, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:77" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 25, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacchylides: <entryFree id="n4807" type="main" key="Bacchy^li^de_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchylĭdēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bakxuli/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n4807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek lyric poet of Ceos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a nephew of Simonides</hi>, who lived about 470 B.C., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 4, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacchylĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bacchylides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. 2, 5, p. 1819</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
bacciballum: <entryFree id="n4808" type="hapax" key="bacciballum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacciballum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">basioballum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, a word of uncertain meaning, found only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 61</bibl>.</entryFree>
baccifer: <entryFree id="n4809" type="main" key="bacci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baccĭfer</orth>, v. bacifer.</entryFree>
baccina: <entryFree id="n4810" type="main" key="bacci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baccīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Apollinaris, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 22</bibl>. <pb n="219" /> <cb n="BACU" /></sense></entryFree>
bacenis: <entryFree id="n4811" type="main" key="Ba^ce_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Băcēnis</orth> (<foreign lang="greek">*bake/nnh</foreign>), <sense id="n4811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great forest in Germany;</hi> doubtless <hi rend="ital">the western part of the Thuringian Forest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Fulda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baceolus: <entryFree id="n4812" type="hapax" key="bace^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>used by Augustus for stultus</itype> <etym>prob. from <foreign lang="greek">ba/khlos o( a)no/htos</foreign>, Hesych.</etym>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>.</entryFree>
bacifer: <entryFree id="n4813" type="main" key="ba_ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bācĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>baca-fero</etym>. <sense id="n4813.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bearing berries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 20, § 50</bibl></cit> (al. leg. bacas fert): <cit><quote lang="la">hedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 414" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 414</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4813.1" n="II" level="1"> Acc. to baca, I. B., <hi rend="ital">bearing olives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:596" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 596</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bacillum: <entryFree id="n4814" type="main" key="ba^cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băcillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">băcillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 13, 1</bibl>) <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>baculus</etym>, <sense id="n4814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl> dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 28</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4814.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the wand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">staff of the lictor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anteibant lictores, non cum bacillis, sed cum fascibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bacis: <entryFree id="n4815" type="main" key="Bacis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*ba/kis, idos</foreign>, Pausan.), <sense id="n4815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothsayer of Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4816" type="main" key="Bacis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bacis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Bacchis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pacis</orth>), <case>acc.</case> Bacem, <sense id="n4816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacred bull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worshipped at Hermonthis in Upper Egypt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bacrio: <entryFree id="n4817" type="gloss" key="bacrio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bacrio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vessel with a long handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ladle</hi>: i. q. trulla, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=31" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 31</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
bactra: <entryFree id="n4818" type="main" key="Bactra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 48</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/ktra</foreign>, <sense id="n4818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief city of Bactria</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Bactriana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Balkh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 16; 3, 11 (4, 10), 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:764" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 764</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 58</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = Bactri, <hi rend="ital">the Bactrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 688</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4818.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4818.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bactriana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4818.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bac-trĭa</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Bactrians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bactria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 26, § 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4818.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactrĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n4818.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to the city of Bactra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Bactra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 45, 17, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4818.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to the kingdom of Bactriana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bactrian;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactriāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Bactri, <hi rend="ital">the Bactrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:20" default="NO">7, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:25" default="NO">7, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 57</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, collect. for <hi rend="ital">the land of Bactriana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl>.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactriāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra), = Bactria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 35</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n4818.7" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Bactrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">camelus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4818.8" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bac-trĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">Halcyoneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bactroperita: <entryFree id="n4819" type="greek" key="bactro^perita"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bactrŏperita</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ba/ktron</foreign>, a staff—<foreign lang="greek">ph/ra</foreign>, pouch</etym>, <sense id="n4819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carrying staff and pouch; a nickname for a Cynic philosopher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Matth. 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:53" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bactrum: <entryFree id="n4820" type="main" key="Bactrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactrum</orth>, v. Bactra <sense id="n4820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bactrus: <entryFree id="n4821" type="main" key="Bactrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bactrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/ktros</foreign>, <sense id="n4821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river near Bactra</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Dehas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 267</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 21, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 1, 11</bibl>; 9, 2, 43.</sense></entryFree>
bacula: <entryFree id="n4822" type="main" key="ba_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bācŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>baca</etym>, <sense id="n4822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small berry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 54, § 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 58; 5, p. 159.</sense></entryFree>
baculum: <entryFree id="n4823" type="main" key="ba^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">băcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, rare, and not before the Aug. period; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 789</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:38:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 38, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 22, 4</bibl>; cf. bacillum), [like <foreign lang="greek">ba/ktron</foreign>, from root ba- of <foreign lang="greek">ba/cw, biba/cw, bai/nw</foreign>, to go = Sanscr. ga], <sense id="n4823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a support in walking</hi> (class.; while scipio is a staff for ornament, and fustis a stick for beating; Doed. Syn. III. p. 266 sqq.; but later used in all these signiff.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bacillum): proximus lictor, Sextius, converso baculo oculos misero tundere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baculum agreste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastorale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:334" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 334</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 218</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 655</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 659</bibl>; 6, 27; 8, 693; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 484</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">baculi crassitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 96, § 255</bibl></cit>.— So, baculum (-us) et pera, <hi rend="ital">staff and pouch</hi>, badges of Cynic philosophers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:53" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 288, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 53</bibl> (cf. bactroperita); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 14, 44, § 129</bibl> Gron.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in baculo me transivi Jordanum istum,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>as a poor pilgrim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 32, 10</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the augural staff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lituus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A sceptre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">baculum aureum (regis) berylli distinguebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 11, 3</bibl>. —And of the sceptre on the stage, in tragic <cb n="BAGR" /> representations, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora serpentum baculi violaverat ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 325</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20</bibl> (21), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">summa papaverum capita dicitur baculo decussisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baculorum subactiones,</quote> <trans><tr>blows with small staves</tr>, <tr>sticks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4823.1" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat. from baculus; trop., <hi rend="ital">a support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an speras in baculo arundineo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 18, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baculum senectutis nostrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tob. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4823.2" n="2" level="3"> As instrument of wrath, <hi rend="ital">rod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 10, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
badia: <entryFree id="n4824" type="main" key="Badi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Badĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Baetica, now <hi rend="ital">Sa. Maria de Bedoza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Budŭa</orth>, Itin. Anton. 419.</sense></entryFree>
badisso: <entryFree id="n4825" type="greek" key="ba^disso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bădisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n4825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.n.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">badi/cw</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to walk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 116</bibl> Fleck. (MSS. badizas; v. Ussing ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
baditis: <entryFree id="n4826" type="main" key="ba_di_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bādītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plant</hi>, = nymphaea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
badius: <entryFree id="n4827" type="main" key="ba^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bădĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chestnutcolored</hi> (rare; only of horses), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 80, 2</bibl>; Pal. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 536</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baduhennaelucus: <entryFree id="n4828" type="main" key="Baduhennae lu_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baduhennae lūcus</orth>, <sense id="n4828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forest in the north of Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Friesland</hi> (perh. now <hi rend="ital">Hold Pade</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baebius: <entryFree id="n4829" type="main" key="Baebi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baebĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, e. g., </sense><sense id="n4829.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Baebius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4829.2" n="2" level="3"> Q. Baebius Tampilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 17, 8</bibl> Drak.; v. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:6" default="NO">7, 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4829.3" n="3" level="3"> G. Baebius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 1</bibl>.—Whence, Baebia lex de praetoribus creandis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 44, 2</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. rogat, p. 233.</sense></entryFree>
baecula: <entryFree id="n4830" type="main" key="Baecu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baecŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n4830.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small town in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Bœtica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Baylen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 13, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4830.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another town in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Ebro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Ausetani</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">*bai/kula</foreign>, Ptol.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Baecŭlōnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Baecula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baeticatus: <entryFree id="n4831" type="main" key="Baeti^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Baetis</etym>, <sense id="n4831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in Bœtican wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:97:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 97, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baeticola: <entryFree id="n4832" type="main" key="Baeti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Baetis-colo</etym>, <sense id="n4832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwelling on the river Bœtis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:146" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baetigena: <entryFree id="n4833" type="main" key="Baeti^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Baetis-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n4833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born on the Bœtis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:234" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 234</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
baetis: <entryFree id="n4834" type="main" key="Baetis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕtis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. ad Aus. 10, 236</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Baetin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 12</bibl> (al. Baetim); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:62:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 62, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Fesc. 12, 31</bibl>; Mall. Theod. 285; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 238</bibl>: <sense id="n4834.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">BAETEM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 153, 4</bibl></cit>; <case>abl.</case> Baete, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baeti (al. Baete),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 21</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*bai=tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a river in Southern Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called by the inhabitants Certis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Guadalquivir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl>, §§ 7 and 13.—</sense><sense id="n4834.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Bœtis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, pr. 20: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:65:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 65, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4834.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*baitikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the province of Bœtica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying on the Bœtis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Southern Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for its excellent wool</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Andalusia and a part of Granada</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO">2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:6" default="NO">3, 1, 6</bibl>; 3, 6, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:196" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 76, § 196</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 78 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4834.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baetica lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacernae,</quote> <trans><tr>made of the Bœtican wool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:133" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 133</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bœtica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baetulo: <entryFree id="n4835" type="main" key="Baetu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">the Besos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baetulus: <entryFree id="n4836" type="greek" key="baetu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baetŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bēt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bai/tulos</foreign>, <sense id="n4836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round and of a dark color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of</hi> ceraunia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 51, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baeturia: <entryFree id="n4837" type="main" key="Baetu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baetūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*baitouri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n4837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Bœturia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the north-west part of</hi> Hispania Baetica, <hi rend="ital">between the Bœtis and Anas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bagada: <entryFree id="n4838" type="main" key="Bagada"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bagada</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bagaudae: <entryFree id="n4839" type="main" key="Bagaudae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bagaudae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a class of peasants in Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who rebelled under the emperor Diocletian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and were finally conquered by Maximian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bagaudĭca</orth> <itype>rebellio</itype>, <hi rend="ital">rebellion of the peasants</hi>, Eum. pro Restaur. Schol. 4.</sense></entryFree>
bagous: <entryFree id="n4840" type="foreign" key="Ba^go_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Băgōus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Băgōas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bagw=os</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*bagw/as</foreign> [Persian], <sense id="n4840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a eunuch at the Persian court</hi>: Bagou (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Gr. = <foreign lang="greek">*bagw/ou</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 41</bibl>.—Form Bagoas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 21</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">any guard of women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bagrada: <entryFree id="n4841" type="main" key="Ba^gra^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Băgrăda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bagra/das</foreign>, <sense id="n4841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river</hi> <cb n="BALA" /> <hi rend="ital">in Zeugitana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Utica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mejerdah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 14, 14, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 588</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">its frequent overflow fertilized its banks,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:141" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 141</bibl></cit> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
baia: <entryFree id="n4842" type="main" key="baia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Copt. bai, whence <foreign lang="greek">ba/i+s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n4842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a palm-branch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Jovin. 3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baiae: <entryFree id="n4843" type="main" key="Ba_iae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bāiae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bai=(ai</foreign>, <sense id="n4843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the coast between Cumœ and Puteoli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a favorite resort of the Romans on account of its warm baths and pleasant situation;</hi> acc. to the fable, built by one of the companions of Ulysses (<bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 441</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Strabo, 5, p. 376): homo durus ac priscus invectus est in eos, qui mense Aprili apud Balas essent et aquis calidis uterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:in Clod. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. in Clod. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:27" default="NO">1, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl> (4), 18, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 2</bibl> sqq.; 1, 15, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 1</bibl> sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Aquae Cumanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baiae aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4843.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">any wateringplace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 35</bibl>; 20, 47; 20, 49; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:13:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 13, 3</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl> Huschk.—</sense><sense id="n4843.2" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Baiānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Baiœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Baiœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Baian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murex,</quote> <trans><tr>from the sea-coast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:43" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucrinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Lucrine lake</tr>, <tr>situated near Baiœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:82 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 82 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4843.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Baiānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the region of Baiœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Baian territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bajulatio: <entryFree id="n4844" type="gloss" key="ba_ju^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bājŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bajulo</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">bastagmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying of burdens</hi>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
bajulator: <entryFree id="n4845" type="gloss" key="ba_ju^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bājŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">bastakth/s, a)xqofo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n4845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porter</hi>, Gloss. Cyril.</sense></entryFree>
bajulatorius: <entryFree id="n4846" type="hapax" key="ba_ju^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bājŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bajulator</etym>, <sense id="n4846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a carrier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <trans><tr>a sedan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:15:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bajulo: <entryFree id="n4847" type="main" key="ba_ju^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bājŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>bajulus</etym>, <sense id="n4847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry a burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear something heavy</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">basta/cw</foreign> (mostly ante-and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ferri proprie dicimus quae quis suo corpore bajulat, portari ea, quae quis in jumento secum ducit, agi ea, quae animalia sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:235" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus bajulans sarcinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 14, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4847.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjectionem debiti alieni, Cod. Th. 5, 15, 3: crucem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 14, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bajulus: <entryFree id="n4848" type="main" key="ba_ju^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bājŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">fe/rw</foreign>, fero; Engl. bear; and with Germ. Bahre, Bürde; cf. Doed. Syn. I. p. 151, and bajulo</etym>, <sense id="n4848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who bears burdens</hi> (for pay), <hi rend="ital">a porter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">day-laborer</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">bastakth/s</foreign>: quod genus Graeci <foreign lang="greek">a)xqofo/rous</foreign> vocant, Latine bajulos appellamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl>: bajulos dicebant antiqui, quos nunc dicimus operarios, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 17</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum de bonis est quaerendum, quid bajuli atque operarii, an quid homines doctissimi senserint?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:257" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 257</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum bajulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:7" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 15</bibl> ad Damas. 5: stercorum, Firm.
