Math. 8, 20.— </sense><sense id="n4848.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in late Lat., </sense><sense id="n4848.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bearer at a funeral</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 19</bibl> ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vespillones dicti sunt bajuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Expos. Serm. p. 558</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4848.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A letter-carrier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 6</bibl> ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Julian.</author> 1</bibl>; Cod. Th. 2, 27, 1, § 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">boni nuntii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 18, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balaena: <entryFree id="n4849" type="greek" key="ba_laena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bālaena</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bālēna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/laina</foreign>, Engl. whale (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 25</bibl>, and the letter B.), <sense id="n4849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 13, 15, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:235" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 40, 95, § 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balaenacius: <entryFree id="n4850" type="main" key="ba_laena_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bālaenācĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bālēn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>balaena</etym>, <sense id="n4850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of whalebone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balanatus: <entryFree id="n4851" type="main" key="ba^la^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălănātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>balanus, II. 3.</etym>, <sense id="n4851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anointed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perfumed with balsam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embalmed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:37" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 37</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 836</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
balaninus: <entryFree id="n4852" type="greek" key="ba^la^ni^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălănĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bala/ninos</foreign>, <sense id="n4852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepared from the fruit of the balsam</hi> (v. balanus, II. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balanites: <entryFree id="n4853" type="greek" key="ba^la^ni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălănītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">balani/ths</foreign> (acornshaped), <sense id="n4853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 15, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balanitis: <entryFree id="n4854" type="greek" key="ba^la^ni^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălănĭtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">balani=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n4854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skaped like an acorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castanea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balanus: <entryFree id="n4855" type="greek" key="ba^la^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> and rarely <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n4855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <pb n="220" /> <cb n="BALI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl>; Metell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>; cf. Rudd. I. p. 31), = <foreign lang="greek">ba/lanos</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n4855.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an acorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:151" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 20, 34, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 4, 9, § 42</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4855.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4855.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any fruit of similar form.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4855.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of large chestnut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4855.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Phœnician and Cilician date</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4855.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A nut yielding a balsam; the Arabian behen-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ben-nut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyperanthera semidecandra, Vahl. (called myrobalanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 21, 46, § 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 20, 23, § 49</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">pressa tuis balanus capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also for <hi rend="ital">the tree itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 17, § 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4855.7" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">any object in the form of an acorn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4855.8" n="1" level="3"> Medic. t., <hi rend="ital">a suppository</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:31" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 21, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:54" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 34, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4855.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A shell-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species cf sea-mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; Metell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balatro: <entryFree id="n4856" type="main" key="ba^la_^tro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălā^tro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. blatero</etym>; lit., <sense id="n4856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a babbler;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a jester</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who makes sport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a buffoon</hi> (it seems to have desig-nated a class of actors, perh. <hi rend="ital">a harlequin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jester</hi>, or something similar): <cit><quote lang="la">mendici, mimae, balatrones, hoc genus omne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 21</bibl>.—Facetè, in Varr. as a designation of his friends when in dispute, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 1</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4857" type="main" key="Ba^la_^tro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bălā^tro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n4857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cognomen of</hi> Servilius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 40</bibl>; 2, 8, 64; 2, 8, 83; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in modum rustici Balatronis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 153</bibl></cit>; cf. scurra.</sense></entryFree>
balatus: <entryFree id="n4858" type="main" key="ba_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bālātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>balo</etym>, <sense id="n4858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bleating of sheep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 369</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni Balatum exercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 554</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 319</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 320</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:46" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 46</bibl>.—Also in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 540</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the bleating of goats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 55, § 156</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 76, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balaustium: <entryFree id="n4859" type="greek" key="ba^lausti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălaustĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">balau/stion</foreign>, <sense id="n4859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flower of the wild pomegranate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:297" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 85" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 85</bibl> and 112; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balbe: <entryFree id="n4860" type="main" key="balbe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balbē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. balbus <sense id="n4860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
balbillus: <entryFree id="n4861" type="main" key="Balbillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Balbillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scholar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prefect in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1</bibl>, prooem. § 3 Jan. (al. Balbilius, Babbillus).</sense></entryFree>
balbus: <entryFree id="n4862" type="main" key="balbus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with balo; cf. Sanscr. barh, barrire, and barbarus</etym>, <sense id="n4862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stammering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuttering</hi> (opp. planus, speaking fluently, without impediment): balba, loqui non quit? <foreign lang="greek">trauli/zei</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">does she</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the loved one</hi>) <hi rend="ital">stammer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">can she not speak distinctly?</hi> (<hi rend="ital">then he says</hi>) <hi rend="ital">she lisps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1164</bibl>: Demosthenes cum ita balbus esset, ut ejus ipsius artis, cui studeret (sc. rhetoricae), primam litteram (sc. <hi rend="ital">r</hi>) non posset dicere, perfecit meditando, ut nemo planius esse locutus putaretur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 260</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and thus in ridicule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:94" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 274</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">balbā de nare loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak through the nose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:33" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">balbē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">stammeringly</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1021" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1021</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4862.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">obscurely</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 80, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4863" type="main" key="Balbus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Balbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 4</bibl>; id. Balb. passim; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:78 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 78 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
balbutio: <entryFree id="n4864" type="main" key="balbu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balbūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-uttio</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n4864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [balbus]. </sense><sense id="n4864.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stammer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stutter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balbutire est cum quādam linguae haesitatione et confusione trepidare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 80, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 31</bibl>: lingua, Cod. 15, 6, 22. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of birds, <hi rend="ital">not to sing clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">merula hieme balbutit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 42, § 80</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4864.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to speak upon something obscurely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not distinctly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not correctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desinant balbutire (Academici), aperteque et clarā voce audeant dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4864.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stammer</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lisp out something</hi>: illum Balbutit Scaurum pravis fultum male talis, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lisping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fondling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calls him Scaurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 48</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as above: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicus perpauca balbutiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balcia: <entryFree id="n4865" type="main" key="Balci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Balcĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Baltĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, acc. to Xenophon of Lampsacus, <sense id="n4865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large island</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three days</hi>' <hi rend="ital">sail from the coast of Scythia</hi>, called by Pythias <hi rend="ital">Basilia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baliares: <entryFree id="n4866" type="main" key="Ba^li^a_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bălĭāres</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bălĕāres</orth>) <itype>insulae</itype>, or <sense id="n4866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bălĭāres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*baliarei=s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Balearic Islands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Majorca and Minorca</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Mediterranean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose inhabitants were famous slingers</hi>, <cb n="BALL" /> Auct. B. Afr. 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 732</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 37, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:226 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 58, 83, § 226 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4866.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n4866.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bă-lĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Balearic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 19, 59, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:279" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 279</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bălĭāres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*baliarei=s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the Balearic Islands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 37, 6</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number> Baliaris, <hi rend="ital">a Balearian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:365" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 365</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4866.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bălĭārĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Balearic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 44, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 727</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 709</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bălĭārĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the Balearic Islands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 218</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 168</bibl>; and Baliaricus, <hi rend="ital">cognomen of</hi> Q. Caecilius Metellus, <hi rend="ital">on account of his conquest of these islands</hi>, A. U. C. 631, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balineae: <entryFree id="n4867" type="main" key="ba^li^ne^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălĭnĕae</orth> = balneae, v. balneum, I. B.</entryFree>
balinearius: <entryFree id="n4868" type="main" key="ba^li^ne^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălĭnĕārĭus</orth>, v. balnearius <sense id="n4868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
balineum: <entryFree id="n4869" type="main" key="ba^li^ne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bălĭnĕum</orth>, v. balneum <sense id="n4869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
balinienses: <entryFree id="n4870" type="main" key="Balinienses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Balinienses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name given to the Trebulani</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baliolus: <entryFree id="n4871" type="hapax" key="bali^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>balius = badius</etym>, <sense id="n4871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chestnut-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexari baliolum (sc. Afrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 22</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
balista: <entryFree id="n4872" type="main" key="balista1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balista, balistārĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">balistĭa</orth>, v. ballist-.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4873" type="main" key="Balista2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Balista</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ballista</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 41, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ballator: <entryFree id="n4874" type="gloss" key="balla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ballo</etym>, <sense id="n4874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dancer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SODALES. BALLATORES. CYBELAE.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2337</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ballematicus: <entryFree id="n4875" type="main" key="balle_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballēmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. ballo</etym>, <sense id="n4875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accompanying the dance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 21, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ballio: <entryFree id="n4876" type="main" key="Ballio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ballio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a worthless pimp in the Pseudolus of Plautus;</hi> hence, for designating <hi rend="ital">any worthless man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl>.— Whence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ballĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Ballio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ballista: <entryFree id="n4877" type="greek" key="ballista1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballista</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">balista</orth>; in Gloss. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ballistra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ba/llw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n4877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lārge military engine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling a bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretched with cords and thongs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which masses of stone and other missiles were thrown to a great distance; a machine for projectiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ballista</hi> (orig. diff. from catapulta, which was used for throwing arrows; but afterwards often interchanged with it; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 16</bibl>-18; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 22</bibl>): centenariae, <hi rend="ital">throwing stones of a hundred pounds weight</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 555, 25</bibl>: ballistae lapidum et reliqua tormenta telorum eo graviores emissiones habent, quo sunt contenta atque adducta vehementius, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl> (6), 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:334" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 686</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 6, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 51.—Sportively: meus est ballista pugnus, cubitus catapulta est mihi, umerus aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>. —For throwing other missiles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 686</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:465" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 465</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4877.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the weapon thrown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a missile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lucil. lib. XXVIII.: ballistas jactans centenarias. Sisenn. Hist. lib. IIII: ballistas quattuor talentarias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 555, 24 sq.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n4877.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam infortunii intenta ballista probe,</quote> <trans><tr>an instrument</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n4878" type="main" key="Ballista2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ballista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. Balista.</entryFree>
ballistarium: <entryFree id="n4879" type="main" key="ballista_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballistārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">balist-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = ballista, or <sense id="n4879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place where the ballista is worked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 74</bibl> (cf. ballista <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
ballistarius: <entryFree id="n4880" type="main" key="ballista_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballistārĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">balist-</orth>; and in Gloss. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ballistrārĭus</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. ballista</etym>. <sense id="n4880.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A maker of ballistœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">COLLEGIVM BALLISTARIORVM.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4066</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4880.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who discharges the ballista</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slinger</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ballistia: <entryFree id="n4881" type="greek" key="ballisti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballistĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">balist-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">balli/cw</foreign>, to dance</etym>, <sense id="n4881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">music</hi> or <hi rend="ital">songs accompanying dancing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 6</bibl>, where an example of such dancing songs is given.</sense></entryFree>
ballo: <entryFree id="n4882" type="hapax" key="ballo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ba/llw, balli/cw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n4882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 215" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 215</bibl> (hence, Fr. <hi rend="ital">bal;</hi> Engl. <hi rend="ital">ball</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
ballonoti: <entryFree id="n4883" type="main" key="Ballo^no^ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ballŏnŏti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:160" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ballote: <entryFree id="n4884" type="greek" key="ballo_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballōtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ballwth/</foreign>, <sense id="n4884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> porrum nigrum, <hi rend="ital">black horehound</hi>:<cb n="BALN" />  Ballota nigra, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 30, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ballux: <entryFree id="n4885" type="foreign" key="ballux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ballux</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bal-</orth>), <itype>ūcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Spanish</etym>, <sense id="n4885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gold-sand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold-dust</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">xru/sammos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1, 10</bibl> (less correctly paludibus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 57, 9</bibl> (less correctly paludes); and Latinized <orth extent="full" lang="la">ballūca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bal-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Cod. Valent. 11, 6, 1 and 2; Cod. Th. 10, 19, 3 and 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balneae: <entryFree id="n4886" type="main" key="balneae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balneae</orth>, v. balneum.</entryFree>
balnearis: <entryFree id="n4887" type="main" key="balne^a_ri^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕārĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>balneum</etym>, <sense id="n4887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a bath</hi> (post-Aug. for the foll.): <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>silver utensils used in baths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕā-rĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">bathing utensils</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 134, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balnearius: <entryFree id="n4888" type="main" key="balne^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕārĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bălĭneārĭus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 171, 8</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a bath</hi> (class. for the preced.): <cit><quote lang="la">fur,</quote> <trans><tr>lurking about baths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 33, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. the title in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de furibus balneariis: furtum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: instrumentum,</quote> <trans><tr>a bathing implement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:21:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 21, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a place for bathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bathing-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ei restabat praeter balnearia et ambulationem et aviarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balneaticum: <entryFree id="n4889" type="main" key="balne^a_ti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕātĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n4889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece of money to be paid for a bath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bath-money;</hi> only in Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 152</bibl>; and in Vet. Gloss.: balneaticum <foreign lang="greek">balaniko/n</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
balneator: <entryFree id="n4890" type="main" key="balne^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 159</bibl>, and Prob. p. 1452 P., <sense id="n4890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. comm.</hi>, yet v. balneatrix) [balneum], <hi rend="ital">one who has the care of a bath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bath-keeper</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">balaneu/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">balnearis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:30:section=1 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 30, § 1 al.</bibl>—Facetè, of Neptune: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol, Neptune, es balneator frigidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balneatorius: <entryFree id="n4891" type="main" key="balne^ato_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕatōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>balneator</etym>, <sense id="n4891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of or pertaining to a bath</hi>, = balnearius: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balneatrix: <entryFree id="n4892" type="main" key="balne^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who has the care of a bath</hi>, Petr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balneolum: <entryFree id="n4893" type="main" key="balne^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕŏlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>balneum</etym>, <sense id="n4893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balneolum angustum, tenebricosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus balneolas suspendit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Hortens. Fragm. 69</bibl></cit> B. and K. (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 194, 13</bibl>); Aug. contra Ac. 3, 4.</sense></entryFree>
balneum: <entryFree id="n4894" type="greek" key="balne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕum</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen> (in <number>plur.</number> usu. heterocl. <orth extent="full" lang="la">balnĕae</orth>, ārum. <gen>f.</gen>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 48</bibl> Müll.; since the Aug. per. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">bal-nĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; cf. Dör. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 8, 2</bibl>) [contr. from <orth extent="full" lang="la">bălĭnĕum</orth>, <itype>also in use</itype>, and in Plaut. and post-Aug. prose predominant, = <foreign lang="greek">balanei=on</foreign>; <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bălĭnĕae</orth>; the Lat. bal-neum stands for bad-neum, kindr. with Sanscr. root bād, lavare, se lavare; Germ. Bad; Engl. bath]. <sense id="n4894.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place for bathing</hi> (the public bath, as consisting of several apartments, only in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 68</bibl> Müll.; cf. aedes and aqua. Varro 1. 1. seems to assert that only the <number>sing.</number> was used for private baths, but this was not without exception, at least in a subsequent age; cf. Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:153" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 12, 54, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:15:2 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 15, 2 al.</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n4894.1" n="A" level="2"> Balneum, <number>plur.</number> balneae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">balneae Seniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balneae Palatinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 51, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 223</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 196, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) ambulavit in litore: post horam octavam in balneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52</bibl></cit>. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">de structurā balnei cogitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4894.2" n="B" level="2"> Balineum, <number>plur.</number> balineae: <cit><quote lang="la">balineum calfieri jubebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 13, 5</bibl> (with the var. lect. balneo): <cit><quote lang="la">in balineas ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensiles balineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:87" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 43, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:115" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 38, § 115</bibl>; 33, 12, 54, § 153; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 6</bibl>; 10, 75, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl> Oud.; 85; 94; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 32 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4894.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> <itype>balnea, ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14</bibl>, <pb n="221" /> <cb n="BAMB" /> 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 298</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 640</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:90:25" default="NO">90, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 248</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:121" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 24, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:375" default="NO">6, 375</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:419" default="NO">6, 419</bibl>; 7, 131; 7, 178; 7, 233 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:19:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:70:13" default="NO">10, 70, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:50:2" default="NO">12, 50, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3324</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4816</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 26, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4894.4" n="II" level="1"> In Pliny, <hi rend="ital">a bath</hi> (in abstracto); <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in the connec. a balineis,</quote> <trans><tr>after the bath</tr>, <tr>after bathing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19</bibl></cit> 77, § 248; 13, 15, 30, § 99; 20, 14, 57, § 160; 24, 19, 118, § 181.</sense></entryFree>
balo: <entryFree id="n4895" type="main" key="ba_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bālo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 7</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root bal = bar; Sanscr. barh, barrire; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ba/rbaros</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">blhxh/, e)/braxe</foreign>; but cf. also Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n4895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bleat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:740" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 740</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:706" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 706</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: balantes hostiae = oves, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21</bibl> (Trag. v. 61 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecus balans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:233" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 233</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> balans = ovis (so <foreign lang="greek">mhka/s</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">mhka/omai</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">balantum grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 272</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 457</bibl>.—Facetè, <hi rend="ital">to speak of sheep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis balasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4895.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to talk foolishly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornificius balare convincitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balsa: <entryFree id="n4896" type="main" key="Balsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Balsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Lusitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Javira</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balsameus: <entryFree id="n4897" type="hapax" key="balsa^me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balsămĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>balsamum</etym>, <sense id="n4897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">balsamic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of balsam</hi>: unguen, Auct. Carm. Phoen. 118.</sense></entryFree>
balsaminus: <entryFree id="n4898" type="greek" key="balsa^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balsămĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">balsa/minos</foreign>, <sense id="n4898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of balsam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 47, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balsamodes: <entryFree id="n4899" type="greek" key="balsa^mo_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balsămōdes</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">balsamw/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n4899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in balsam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 43, § 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
balsamum: <entryFree id="n4900" type="greek" key="balsa^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">balsămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ba/lsamon</foreign>. <sense id="n4900.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fragrant gum of the balsam-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balsam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 8 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">balsama olet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:63" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 27, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4900.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The balsam-tree</hi>: Amyris opobalsamum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baltearius: <entryFree id="n4901" type="gloss" key="balte^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baltĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>balteus</etym>, <sense id="n4901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker</hi> or <hi rend="ital">master of sword-belts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3501</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balteatus: <entryFree id="n4902" type="hapax" key="balte^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baltĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from <orth extent="full" lang="la">bal-tĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, Gloss. Isid. [id.], <sense id="n4902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with a girdle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 426</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balteolus: <entryFree id="n4903" type="hapax" key="balte^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baltĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small girdle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 2, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
balteus: <entryFree id="n4904" type="main" key="balte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baltĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, more rare <orth extent="full" lang="la">baltĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (in <number>plur.</number> baltea was generally used in the poets metri gr.; and in ante-class. prose balteum, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=116" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 116</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 194, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 59</bibl> P.) [acc. to Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1</bibl>. 1. a Tuscan word; but cf. O. H. Germ. balz; Engl. belt] (not in Cic.). <sense id="n4904.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belt;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">a swordbelt</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the band passing over the shoulder</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 140</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq.): baltea, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 194, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Varr. ib.: infelix umero cum apparuit alto Balteus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:942" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 942</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lato quam circumplectitur auro Balteus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 313</bibl></cit> Serv.; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 274: verutum in balteo defigitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: aurata baltea illis erant, Liv. H. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 194, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregarius miles viatica sua et balteos phalerasque loco pecuniae tradebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 39</bibl>: regum, ib. Job, 12, 18.—</sense><sense id="n4904.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, like <foreign lang="greek">zwsth/r</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a woman</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s girdle;</hi> so of that of Amazonian queens at Thermodon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 189</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the girdle of the wife of Cato</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 362</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:207" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 207</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4904.2" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The girdle of the Jewish high-priest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4904.3" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The girdle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belly-band</hi> of a horse, = cingula, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4904.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which surrounds like a girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a border</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4904.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The belt of the heavens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the zodiac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellatus balteus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 677</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 334</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4904.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The edge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the crust of a cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 3</bibl>, and 78.—</sense><sense id="n4904.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The bark of the willow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4904.8" n="D" level="2"> = praecinctio, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dia/cwma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the vacant space between the seats in the amphitheatre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:47" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4904.9" n="E" level="2"> Baltei pulvinorum, in architecture, <hi rend="ital">the broad bands by which the cushions upon Ionic capitals are</hi>, as it were, <hi rend="ital">held together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4904.10" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A strapping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow with a belt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties rumoribus ulciscantur Baltea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
baltia: <entryFree id="n4905" type="main" key="Baltia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baltia</orth>, v. Balcia.</entryFree>
baluca: <entryFree id="n4906" type="main" key="baluca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baluca</orth>, <itype>balux</itype>, v. ball.</entryFree>
bambalio: <entryFree id="n4907" type="main" key="Bamba^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bambălĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">bamba/lein</foreign>, to stammer, <foreign lang="greek">bombo/lh</foreign>; Engl. bumblebee</etym>, = <cb n="BARA" /> <foreign lang="greek">*bambali/wn</foreign>, Dio Cass. 45, 47; <sense id="n4907.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">46, 7 and 28: M. Fulvius,</quote> <trans><tr>the father-in-law of Antonius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bambyce: <entryFree id="n4908" type="main" key="Bamby^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bambycē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bambu/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n4908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Cœlosyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Hieropolis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 81</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bambycius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Bambyce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 542</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">646</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
banchus: <entryFree id="n4909" type="main" key="banchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">banchus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">bancus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bandusia: <entryFree id="n4910" type="main" key="Bandu^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bandŭsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pleasant fountain near Venusia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Horace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated by him in song</hi>, C. 3, 13, 1 sq. Ritter and Orell. ad loc. (diff. from the celebrated Digentia of the Ep. 1, 16, 12 and 104, as is shown by the Privilegium Paschalis II. anni 1103 ap. Ughell. Ital. Sacra, tom. vii. col. 30, Ven. 1721; cf. Fea and Jahn upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13</bibl>; Capmartin de Chaupy, Découverte de la maison d'Horace t. iii. pp. 364, 518 and 537).</sense></entryFree>
bangeni: <entryFree id="n4911" type="main" key="Bange_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bangēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a race of Troglodytes in Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bannanica: <entryFree id="n4912" type="main" key="bannanica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bannanica</orth> (sc. vitis), <sense id="n4912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a variety of the vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bantia: <entryFree id="n4913" type="main" key="Banti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*banti/a</foreign>, <sense id="n4913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Apulia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of Venusia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the southern declivity of the mountain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Banzi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 25, 13</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bantīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Bantia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bantīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bantia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bapheus: <entryFree id="n4914" type="greek" key="ba^pheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băpheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bafeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 7, 2</bibl> (al. baphii).</sense></entryFree>
baphium: <entryFree id="n4915" type="greek" key="ba^phi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băphīum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">băphēum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bafei=on</foreign>. <sense id="n4915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dye-house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 40</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 20, 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4272</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baphyrus: <entryFree id="n4916" type="main" key="Baphy^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baphyrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mount Olympus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baptae: <entryFree id="n4917" type="main" key="Baptae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baptae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/ptai</foreign> [perh. so called from dyeing their hair; <sense id="n4917.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">v. Meineke, Com. Fragm. I. p. 119],</quote> <trans><tr>priests of the Thracian</tr>, <tr>afterwards Athenian</tr>, <tr>goddess Cotytto</tr>, <tr>whose festival was celebrated in a very lewd manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 92</bibl></cit> Schol.; cf. Cotytto.</sense></entryFree>
baptes: <entryFree id="n4918" type="main" key="baptes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baptes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">colored amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baptisma: <entryFree id="n4919" type="greek" key="baptisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baptisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ba/ptisma</foreign>. <sense id="n4919.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dipping in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dipping under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">washing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ablution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 103</bibl>; Apoth. 697; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the general deluge</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4919.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">Christian baptism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 4, 5</bibl>; in the Church fathers very freq.—A parallel form <orth extent="full" lang="la">baptismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Cod. Th. 16, 6, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:11:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 11, 30 al.</bibl>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">baptismum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Temp. 36" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Temp. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 25 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
baptista: <entryFree id="n4920" type="greek" key="baptista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baptista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">baptisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n4920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a baptizer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baptist</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of John</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the forerunner of Christ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Pasch. 2, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baptisterium: <entryFree id="n4921" type="greek" key="baptiste_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baptistērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">baptisth/rion</foreign>. <sense id="n4921.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place for bathing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swimming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel for bathing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4921.1" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a baptistery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a baptismal font</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baptizatio: <entryFree id="n4922" type="hapax" key="bapti_za_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baptīzātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>baptizo</etym>, <sense id="n4922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a baptizing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. Temp. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baptizator: <entryFree id="n4923" type="main" key="bapti_za_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baptīzātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a baptizer</hi> (cf. baptista): <cit><quote lang="la">Joannes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baptizo: <entryFree id="n4924" type="greek" key="bapti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baptīzo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bapti/cw</foreign>, only in eccl. Lat., <sense id="n4924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to baptize</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 1, 8</bibl>; and Tert. Aug. Hier. al. saep.</sense></entryFree>
barace: <entryFree id="n4925" type="main" key="Bara^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Barăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baragaza: <entryFree id="n4926" type="main" key="Baragaza"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baragaza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n4926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baraomutae: <entryFree id="n4927" type="main" key="Baraomutae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baraomutae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
barathrum: <entryFree id="n4928" type="greek" key="ba^ra_^thrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bărā^thrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ba/raqron</foreign>, <sense id="n4928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abyss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chasm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deep pit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Lower World</hi> (mostly poet; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vorago),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o barathrum ubi nunc es? ut ego te usurpem lubens (words of one in despair),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:966" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 966</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:117" default="NO" valid="yes">68, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:95:5" default="NO" valid="yes">95, 5</bibl>.—Esp., of <hi rend="ital">the infernal regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri in barathrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imus barathri gurges (Charybdis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 421</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:497" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 497</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena barathri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:86" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a pit made by art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deep dungeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4928.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: quid <cb n="BARB" /> enim differt, barathrone Dones quidquid habes, an numquam utare paratis? <hi rend="ital">thou throwest into the abyss</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">squanderest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 166</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4928.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4928.3" n="A" level="2"> Jocosely or satirically, <hi rend="ital">a maw</hi> (as insatiable), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:88:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 88, 4</bibl>.—Hence Horace calls a greedy man barathrum macelli, <hi rend="ital">an abyss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gulf of the provision market</hi>, Ep. 1, 15, 31.—</sense><sense id="n4928.4" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:81:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 81, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
barathrus: <entryFree id="n4929" type="spur" key="ba^ra^thrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bărăthrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, a false read. for barathrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:966" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 966</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad h. 1.</entryFree>
barba: <entryFree id="n4930" type="main" key="barba1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">barba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. O. H. Germ. part; Germ. Bart; Engl. beard</etym>. <sense id="n4930.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the beard</hi>, of men: <cit><quote lang="la">alba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirquina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <trans><tr>long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 593</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 351</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stiriaque inpexis induruit horrida barbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 366</bibl></cit>: submittere (as a sign of mourning). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam tondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A.
