basilicus: <entryFree id="n5013" type="greek" key="ba^si^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">basiliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">royal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">princely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>, = regalis (in this sense perh. only ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n5013.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n5013.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.. basilicas edictiones atque imperiosas habet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 31</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit> victus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5013.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5013.4" n="1" level="3"> Basilica vitis, <hi rend="ital">a kind of vine among the Dyrrhachians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 30</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:28" default="NO">3, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:7:1:3:9:1:3:21:3" default="NO">3, 7, 1, 3, 9, 1, 3, 21, 3</bibl>' uva, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5013.5" n="2" level="3"> Basilica nux, Macr S. 2, 14, 7.—</sense><sense id="n5013.6" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n5013.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. jactus), = Venereus, <hi rend="ital">the king</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the best throw of dice</hi> (v. alea), Plant. Curc. 2, 3, 80.—</sense><sense id="n5013.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp. freq., <orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">basilikh/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">oi)kia</foreign> s. <foreign lang="greek">stoa/</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a public building in the forum with double colonnades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was used both for judicial tribunals and as an exchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a basilica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portico</hi> (cf. regia, in the year of Rome 542 there were no such porticos there, Liv 26, 27, 3, the first known was built by Cato in the year 568, and called Basilica Porcia, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 39, 44, 7</bibl> Drak., Aur. Vir. Ill. 47; the most considerable basilicae in the Aug. age were the Porcia, Opimia, and Julia; the latter, built by Julius Cæsar in the third year of his dictatorship, was the chief seat of judicial proceedings; v Vitr 5, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">O Müll. Archaeol. § 291, cf. with § 180, Dict of Antiq.) forum plenum et basilicas isto rum hominum videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=152:2:4:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 152, 2, 4, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 70</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:2:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 14, 2, 4, 16, 14</bibl> Julia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Ep 5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep 5, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl>, so, Aemilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 4, § 13</bibl> Pauli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 102</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl>. porti cus Caii et Lucil, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug 29</bibl>. completis undique basilicis ac templis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> H 1, 40</bibl>. —Pure Lat. regia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 30</bibl>; v regius.—In the fourth centu ry churches were first built in the style of basilicas (cf Müll. Archaeol. § 194).— Hence, late Lat., basilica, <hi rend="ital">a metropolitan church</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cathedral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a basilica.</hi> Sulp Sev H. Sacra, 2, 33 and 38.—</sense><sense id="n5013.9" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n5013.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A princely robe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 48</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5013.11" n="2" level="3"> In the Gr form <orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlĭcŏn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">basiliko/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a black plaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 210" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 210</bibl>, also called, 238, <orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlĭcē</orth>, ēs.—</sense><sense id="n5013.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The best kind of nuts</hi>, Phn. 15, 22, 24. § 87; cf. I. B. 2. supra.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">royally</hi>, etc.: exornatus basilice, <hi rend="ital">in princely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mao</hi> <pb n="224" /> <cb n="BAST" /> <hi rend="ital">nificent style</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:1:29" default="NO">1, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:2:25" default="NO">5, 2, 25</bibl>. —Of severe pain: ut ego interii basilice! <hi rend="ital">how wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basilis: <entryFree id="n5014" type="main" key="Ba^si^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Băsĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek geographer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basilisca: <entryFree id="n5015" type="greek" key="ba^si^lisca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlisca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">basili/skh</foreign>, <sense id="n5015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an antidote for the bite of the basilisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> regula, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basiliscus: <entryFree id="n5016" type="greek" key="ba^si^liscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭliscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">basili/skos</foreign>. <sense id="n5016.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of lizard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a basilisk</hi>: Lacerta basiliscus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:78 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 33, § 78 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 90</bibl> (91), 13. —For the deriv. of the word from <foreign lang="greek">basileu/s</foreign> (king), v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 726</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5016.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of</hi> Cn. Pompeius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basilium: <entryFree id="n5017" type="gloss" key="ba^si^li_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băsĭlīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">basi/leion</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a royal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">princely ornament</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2510</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Veron. 293, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basio: <entryFree id="n5018" type="main" key="ba_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bāsĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>basium</etym>, <sense id="n5018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give a kiss</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare; most freq. in Cat.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Plaut. or Ter.): basia multa basiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes">48, 1</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:94:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 94, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:95:7" default="NO">7, 95, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:8" default="NO">11, 98, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">135, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basiolum: <entryFree id="n5019" type="main" key="ba_si^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bāsĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little kiss</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 85 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basis: <entryFree id="n5020" type="greek" key="ba^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băsis</orth>, <itype>is and ĕos</itype> (<sense id="n5020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> basis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 34: baseos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <case>acc.</case> usu. basim, but BASEM, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1263 al.</bibl>: basidem, Ven. Fort. 8, 14; <case>abl.</case> usu. basi, but base, <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Gall. 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 63, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">BASIDE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 14</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> BASIVM, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3272</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ba/sis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a pedestal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5020.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in basi statuarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:63:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 63, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (sc. ad sepulcrum) cum patefactus esset aditus, ad adversam basim accessimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colossici Apollinis basis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra basim eriguntur regulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2</bibl>, epil. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 25, 38, § 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">villae,</quote> <trans><tr>the foundation-wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5020.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bases virtutis,</quote> <trans><tr>foundations</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 6, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5020.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., prov.: aliquem cum basi suā metiri, <hi rend="ital">to measure a pillar together with its pedestal</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give false measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to estimate too high</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5020.4" n="III" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5020.5" n="A" level="2"> In math.: <cit><quote lang="la">basis trianguli,</quote> <trans><tr>the base of a triangle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>the chord of an arc</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:12" default="NO">3, 13, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5020.6" n="B" level="2"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">the lowest part of the shaft of a column</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl> (our pedestal is expressed by spira, q. v.).—</sense><sense id="n5020.7" n="C" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">the primitive word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the root</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5020.8" n="D" level="2"> Of cattle, <hi rend="ital">a track</hi>, <hi rend="ital">footprint</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 46 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
basium: <entryFree id="n5021" type="main" key="ba_si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bāsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for sāvĭum, suavium; cf. Engl. buss; O. Germ. bus</etym>, <sense id="n5021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kiss.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5021.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; most freq. in Cat.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Plaut. or Ter.): da mi basia mille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 9</bibl>; 16, 12; 99, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:21:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:9" default="NO">11, 98, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:55:9" default="NO">12, 55, 9</bibl>; 12, 59, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 2, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impingere alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5021.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a kissing of the hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactat basia tibicen,</quote> <trans><tr>throws kisses of the hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 28</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:117" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bassania: <entryFree id="n5022" type="main" key="Bassa_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bassānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Illyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Elbassan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bas-sānītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bassania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30, 13</bibl> and 15.</sense></entryFree>
bassareus: <entryFree id="n5023" type="main" key="Bassa^reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bassăreus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bassareu/s</foreign> [<foreign lang="greek">bassa/ra</foreign>, a fox, fox-skin, as clothing of the Bacchantes], <sense id="n5023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a title of Bacchus</hi>: candide Bassareu, * Hor C. 1, 18, 11; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5023.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv </sense><sense id="n5023.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bassărĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <trans><tr>the hair of Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 17, 30: metrum, Mar. Vict. p. 2545 P.—</sense><sense id="n5023.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bassăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bassari/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Bacchante</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:101" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 101</bibl> Schol.</sense></entryFree>
bassus: <entryFree id="n5024" type="main" key="Bassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bassus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a family cognomen;</hi> e. g. </sense><sense id="n5024.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Martial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:76:1 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 76, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5024.2" n="II" level="1"> Q. Caecilius Bassus, <hi rend="ital">quœstor</hi> A. U. C. 695, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 18, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5024.3" n="III" level="1"> Lucilius Bassus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bastaga: <entryFree id="n5025" type="greek" key="basta^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bastăga</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">bastăgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bastagh/ [basta/zw</foreign>], <sense id="n5025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carriage of baggage</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a carrying of freight upon wagons</hi>), Cod. Arcad. et Honor 12, 58, 3; Cod. Th. 8, 4, 11.</sense></entryFree>
bastagarius: <entryFree id="n5026" type="main" key="basta^ga_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bastăgārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bastaga</etym>, <sense id="n5026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a baggage-master</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 20, 11; Cod. Valent. et Val. 11, 7, 4.</sense></entryFree>
bastarnae: <entryFree id="n5027" type="main" key="Bastarnae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bastarnae</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Basternae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*basta/rnai</foreign>, <sense id="n5027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe which became known to the Romans very early</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in the war with Pyrrhus</hi>), <hi rend="ital">whose abode extended<cb n="BATR" />  from the sources of the Vistula to the Carpates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and from the Lower Danube to its mouth</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Podolia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Galicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ukraine</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 57, 2</bibl> sq.; 40, 58, 1 sq.; 41, 19, 4 sq.; 41, 23, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basterna: <entryFree id="n5028" type="main" key="basterna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">basterna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sedan chair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">litter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosed on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and carried by mules</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl> ad Eustoch. n. 16; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
basternarius: <entryFree id="n5029" type="main" key="basterna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">basternārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>basterna</etym>, <sense id="n5029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearer of a sedan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:15" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bastertini: <entryFree id="n5030" type="main" key="Basterti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bastertīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lower Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bastetania: <entryFree id="n5031" type="main" key="Baste_ta_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bastētānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bastitani: <entryFree id="n5032" type="main" key="Basti^ta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bastĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Basti in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bastuli: <entryFree id="n5033" type="main" key="Bastu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bastŭli</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Bascŭ-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Baetica, <hi rend="ital">near the Strait of Gibraltar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bascŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bat: <entryFree id="n5034" type="main" key="ba^t1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băt</orth>, a comic word formed to parody the <sense id="n5034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> at: <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Potin aliam rem ut cures? <hi rend="ital">Cali.</hi> At. <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Bat. <hi rend="ital">Cali.</hi> Crucior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 6</bibl> Lorenz ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at enim... bat enim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit> (95).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5035" type="main" key="ba^t2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">băt</orth>, <itype>sonus ex ore cornicinis lituum eximentis</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 213</bibl> P.</entryFree>
batalaria: <entryFree id="n5036" type="hapax" key="ba^ta^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătălārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of war-ship</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batavia: <entryFree id="n5037" type="main" key="Ba^ta_vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bătāvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bataou/a</foreign> Dio, <foreign lang="greek">*batabi/a</foreign> Zosim, <sense id="n5037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the peninsula Batavia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Holland</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. ad Theod. 5" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. ad Theod. 5</bibl> (in class. per. called only Batavorum Insula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 29, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 23</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
batavodurum: <entryFree id="n5038" type="main" key="Ba^ta_vo^du_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bătāvŏdūrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Holland.</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Wyk by Duurstede</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batavus: <entryFree id="n5039" type="main" key="Ba^ta_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bătāvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n5039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Batavia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Batavian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Holland</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Dutch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spuma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Batāvi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bata/ouoi</foreign>, Ptol., <hi rend="ital">the Batavians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hollanders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Dutch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 29 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Batavorum Insula, v. Batavia.—With penult scanned short: Vangiones Bătăvīque truces, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 431</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bătā-vus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Batavi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:176" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 176</bibl>. —Collectively, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:608" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 608</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bateni: <entryFree id="n5040" type="main" key="Bateni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bateni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Oxus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batenim: <entryFree id="n5041" type="main" key="ba^te^nim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătĕnim</orth>, v. 1. bat.</entryFree>
batha: <entryFree id="n5042" type="main" key="Batha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Batha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bathyllus: <entryFree id="n5043" type="main" key="Ba^thyllus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Băthyllus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/qullos</foreign>. <sense id="n5043.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Samian boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved by Anacreon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 9</bibl>; cf. Anacr. 22.—</sense><sense id="n5043.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated pantomime of Alexandria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a favorite of Mœcenas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and rival of the equally celebrated Pylades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl> Gron.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:123" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 123</bibl> Schol.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:32:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 32, 5</bibl>; cf. Suid. s. v. <foreign lang="greek">)/*orxhsis</foreign>, tom. ii. p. 720 Kust.</sense></entryFree>
bathymi: <entryFree id="n5044" type="main" key="Bathymi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bathymi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bathynias: <entryFree id="n5045" type="main" key="Bathynias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bathynias</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Byzantium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batia: <entryFree id="n5046" type="main" key="ba^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 25, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batiaca: <entryFree id="n5047" type="main" key="ba^ti^a^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătĭăca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of drinking-cup</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaphiis, cantharis, Batiacis bibunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 3, 11</bibl></cit> Ritschl, Fleck. (al. batiolis).</sense></entryFree>
batillum: <entryFree id="n5048" type="main" key="ba^tillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătillum</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vatillum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">batillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 27</bibl>). <sense id="n5048.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shovel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fire-shovel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coal-shovel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dungshovel</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">batilli ferrei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 44, § 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:112" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 11, 26, § 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Claud. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5048.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fire-pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chafing-dish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fumigating-pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incense-pan</hi>: prunae batillum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 36</bibl> (Jahn, K. and H. vatillum).</sense></entryFree>
batiola: <entryFree id="n5049" type="main" key="ba^ti^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small drinking-cup</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a goblet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">batiolis bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit> (Ritschl, batiacis): batiola aurea, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 545, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batis: <entryFree id="n5050" type="greek" key="ba^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bati/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seafennel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">samphire</hi>: Crithmum maritimum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 50, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13:2" default="NO">12, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bato: <entryFree id="n5051" type="main" key="Bato"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bato</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader of insurrection in Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 46</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima duobus Batonibus ducibus auctoritas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:4" default="NO">2, 114, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batrachion: <entryFree id="n5052" type="greek" key="ba^tra^chi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătrăchĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">batra/xion [ba/traxos</foreign> = frog], <sense id="n5052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicinal plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> ranunculus [rana = frog], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 109, § 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl> and 9. <cb n="BAUM" /></sense></entryFree>
batrachites: <entryFree id="n5053" type="greek" key="ba^tra^chi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătrăchītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">batraxi/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n5053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a frog-green color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 149</bibl>; ls<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Orig. 16:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Orig. 16, 4, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batrachomyomachia: <entryFree id="n5054" type="main" key="Ba^tra^cho^my^o^ma^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bătrăchŏmyŏmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*batraxomuomaxia</foreign>, <sense id="n5054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Battle of the Frogs and Mice</hi>, the title of a poem falsely attributed to Homer, Stat. S. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:183" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 183</bibl> <hi rend="ital">lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
batrachus: <entryFree id="n5055" type="greek" key="ba^tra^chus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătrăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ba/traxos</foreign>, <sense id="n5055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sea-frog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5056" type="main" key="Ba^tra^chus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bătrăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/traxos</foreign>, <sense id="n5056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek architect at Rome in the time of Pompey the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
battalia: <entryFree id="n5057" type="gloss" key="battalia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">battalia</orth>, v. ‡ battualia.</entryFree>
battara: <entryFree id="n5058" type="main" key="Battara"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Battara</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman whose death is mentioned by Cicero</hi> A. U. C. 700, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
battiades: <entryFree id="n5059" type="main" key="Battiades"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Battiades</orth>, v. Battus, I. b.</entryFree>
battis: <entryFree id="n5060" type="main" key="Battis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Battis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*batti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sweetheart of the poet Philetas of Cos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 58</bibl> (Merkel, Bittis).</sense></entryFree>
batton: <entryFree id="n5061" type="main" key="Batton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Batton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
battualia: <entryFree id="n5062" type="gloss" key="battu^a_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">battŭālĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">battālia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>battuo</etym>, <sense id="n5062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fighting and fencing exercises of soldiers and gladiators</hi>: inde etiam battuatores <foreign lang="greek">tou\s basanista\s</foreign> dici puto, Adamant. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> p. 2300</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
battuarium: <entryFree id="n5063" type="gloss" key="battu^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">battŭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kopanisth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n5063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mortar</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
battuo: <entryFree id="n5064" type="main" key="battuo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">battuo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bāt-</orth>), <itype>ui, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Engl. beat, bat; Fr. battre; Ital. battere</etym>, <sense id="n5064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hit</hi> (very rare): battuit <foreign lang="greek">katako/ptei</foreign>, Gloss.; Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 562, 33</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 60</bibl>.—Of bruising in a mortar, Marc. Emp. Medic. c. 36.—Of pounding flesh before cooking it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2:108" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2, 108</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5064.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, of fencing (like the Germ. schlagen): battuebat pugnatoriis armis, <hi rend="ital">he fenced with sharp weapons</hi> (not with the foil), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
battus: <entryFree id="n5065" type="main" key="Battus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Battus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ba/ttos</foreign>. <sense id="n5065.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name given to Aristotle of Thera</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founder of Cyrene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:57" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:591" default="NO">17, 591</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7, 1</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n5065.1" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Battĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Cyrene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:61" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:252" default="NO">3, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:592" default="NO">17, 592</bibl>; and, <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the poet Callimachus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Cyrene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:367" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 15, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:157" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 157</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5065.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A herdsman of Neleus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Triphylia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Peloponnesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of his betraying a theft of Mercury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was transformed by him into the stone</hi> Index, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:688 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 688 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
batulum: <entryFree id="n5066" type="main" key="Ba^tu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bătŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 739</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:566" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
batuo: <entryFree id="n5067" type="main" key="ba_tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bātŭo</orth>, v. battuo.</entryFree>
batus: <entryFree id="n5068" type="main" key="ba^tu^s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătŭs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bătŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ba/tos</foreign>, <sense id="n5068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the blackberry-bush</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 87</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30, 15</bibl> Müll.; esp., batos Idaea = <foreign lang="greek">ba/tos )*idai/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the raspberry-bush</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5069" type="main" key="ba^tu^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bătŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ba/tos</foreign>; Heb. <foreign />, <sense id="n5069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Hebrew measure for liquids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing about nine gallons</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:45:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 45, 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
baubor: <entryFree id="n5070" type="hapax" key="baubor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baubor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">baii/+zw</foreign></etym>; of dogs, <sense id="n5070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bark gently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moderately</hi> (cf. latrare, to bark angrily): et quom desertei baubantur in aedibus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1071" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1071</bibl>; v. the context, and Munro ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
baucidias: <entryFree id="n5071" type="main" key="Baucidia^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baucidiăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Gulf of Argolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baucis: <entryFree id="n5072" type="main" key="Baucis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baucis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bau=kis</foreign>. <sense id="n5072.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Philemon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Phrygia.</hi> She, with her husband, entertained, in a very hospitable manner, Jupiter and Mercury, who came to them in the form of men; <cit><quote lang="la">in return for which they were changed to two sacred trees before their hut, which became a temple,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:631 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 631 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n5072.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an old woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:21" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
baudos: <entryFree id="n5073" type="main" key="Baudo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Baudŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bauli: <entryFree id="n5074" type="main" key="Bauli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bauli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bau=loi</foreign> [acc. to the fable, from <foreign lang="greek">bou=s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">au)lh/</foreign>, since here Hercules shut up the cattle taken from Geryon; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 662</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl>, both of whom understand the original form as Boaulia], <sense id="n5074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place near Baiœ</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bacolo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:172" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 55, 81, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:63" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bauma: <entryFree id="n5075" type="main" key="Bauma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bauma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Ethiopia</hi>, Plin 6, 29, 35, § 179. <pb n="225" /> <cb n="BEBR" /></sense></entryFree>
bavius: <entryFree id="n5076" type="main" key="Ba^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Băvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stupid poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an enemy of Virgil and Horace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Bavium non odit, amet tua carmina, Maevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 90</bibl></cit> (pro poenā ei contingat, ut diligat Maevium pejorem poëtam. Nam Maevius et Bavius pessimi fuerunt poëtae, inimici tam Horatio quam Vergilio, Serv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 210</bibl>, where is found the attack of Bavius upon Verg. for using hordeum in the <number>plur.</number>; cf. also Philargyr. Verg. E. l. l., and Weich. Poët. Lat. Rel. p. 308 sq.).</sense></entryFree>
baxea: <entryFree id="n5077" type="greek" key="baxe^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baxĕa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">baxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pa/c = u(po/dhma eu)upo/dhton</foreign>, Hesych.</etym>, <sense id="n5077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of woven shoe worn on the comic stage and by philosophers</hi> (only ante- and post-class. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 127, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 260, 39; Flor. n. 9.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 34, 6</bibl> and 13.</sense></entryFree>
baxearius: <entryFree id="n5078" type="gloss" key="baxe^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">baxĕārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">baxĭ-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>baxea</etym>, <sense id="n5078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of woven shoes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">FABER SOLIARIVS BAXIARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4085</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bazaira: <entryFree id="n5079" type="main" key="Baza^i_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bazăīra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Asiatic Scythia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bdellium: <entryFree id="n5080" type="greek" key="bdelli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bdellĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕdella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 19</bibl>; cf. the letter B), = <foreign lang="greek">bde/llion</foreign>, <sense id="n5080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Asiatic plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for its fragrant gum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the vine-palm</hi>: Borassus flabelliformis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 8, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5080.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the costly gum exuding from it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 14, 1</bibl></cit> and 5: <cit><quote lang="la">color bdellii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">tu crocinum et casia es, tu bdellium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
beate: <entryFree id="n5081" type="main" key="be^a_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. beatus <sense id="n5081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> under beo.</sense></entryFree>
beatifico: <entryFree id="n5082" type="main" key="be^a_ti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>beatus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n5082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bless</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 14:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jacob. 5, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beatificus: <entryFree id="n5083" type="main" key="be^a_ti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blessing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making happy</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Doct. Plat. 1, p. 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beatitas: <entryFree id="n5084" type="main" key="be^a_ti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>beatus</etym>, <sense id="n5084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the condition of the</hi> beatus, <hi rend="ital">happiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blessed condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blessedness</hi>, = beata vita, felicitas; <cit><quote lang="la">a word first used by Cic.: aut ista sive beatitas, sive beatitudo dicenda sunt (utrumque omnino durum, sed usu mollienda nobis verba sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 95</bibl></cit> (but he seems to have used neither of the two words again): <cit><quote lang="la">apud Ciceronem beatitas et beatitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Doct. Plat. 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 17.</sense></entryFree>
beatitudo: <entryFree id="n5085" type="main" key="be^a_ti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the condition of</hi> beatus, <hi rend="ital">happiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">felicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blessedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beatitude;</hi> a word coined by Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">beatitas, and pass. there cited. In the post-Aug. per. several times: animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Julian. 23 al.</bibl>; Cod. 12, 47, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 30, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beatulus: <entryFree id="n5086" type="hapax" key="be^a_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n5086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sainted fellow</hi> (iron.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:103" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beatum: <entryFree id="n5087" type="main" key="be^a_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>beo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> A. 3. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
beatus: <entryFree id="n5088" type="main" key="be^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>beo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
beber: <entryFree id="n5089" type="main" key="be^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕber</orth>, bri. <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the beaver</hi> (late Lat. for fiber), Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 34</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">bē^brī-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the beaver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaver-</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bebra: <entryFree id="n5090" type="foreign" key="bebra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bebra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weapon of barbarous nations</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bebriacensis: <entryFree id="n5091" type="main" key="Bebriacensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bebriacensis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bebriacum</orth>, v. Bedr-.</entryFree>
bebrinus: <entryFree id="n5092" type="hapax" key="bebri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bebrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>beber = fiber, a beaver</etym>, <sense id="n5092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a beaver</hi>: pelles, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bebryces: <entryFree id="n5093" type="main" key="Be_bry_^ces1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēbrȳ^ces</orth>, <itype>cum</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -cas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:315" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 315</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*be/bru=kes</foreign>, <sense id="n5093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people inhabiting Bebrycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a province of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards called Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:315" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 315</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5093.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5093.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bē-brȳ^cĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bebruki/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the province inhabited by the Bebrycians</hi>, afterwards <hi rend="ital">Bithynia</hi>, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 5, 373</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:502" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 502</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">y</hi> long in <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 974</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5093.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēbryx</orth>, <itype>ȳ^cis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Bebrycian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:315" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 315</bibl>; and, <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an ancient king in Bebrycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called Amycus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">being powerful in the contest with the cœ-stus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was accustomed to sacrifice foreigners whom he had vanquished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but was finally himself overcome by Pollux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and slain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:261" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 261</bibl> and 290: Bebryca (<case>acc.</case> Gr.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 190</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5093.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēbrȳ^cĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the province Bebrycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Bebrycia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:99" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 220</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5093.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to King Bebryx</hi>: harena, <hi rend="ital">upon which</hi> <cb n="BELI" /> <hi rend="ital">Pollux fought with Amycus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:28" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <trans><tr>in which Amycus lay in wait for foreigners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:352" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 3, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <trans><tr>the blood shed by him</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. Sod. 2</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Bithynian king Prusias</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 304</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5094" type="main" key="Be_bry_ces2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēbrȳces</orth>, <itype>cum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*be/bru=kes</foreign> [perh. of kindred origin with the preced.], <sense id="n5094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Pyrenees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:423 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 423 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5094.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5094.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēbryx</orth>, <itype>ȳcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Bebrycian;</hi> <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an ancient king of the Bebrycians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose daughter Pyrene gave name to the mountains there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:423" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 423</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5094.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēbrycĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to King Bebryx</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bebrycian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:443" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pyrene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:420" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 420</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
beccus: <entryFree id="n5095" type="greek" key="beccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">beccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gallic; cf. Fr. bec; Engl. beak</etym>, <sense id="n5095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bill</hi>, esp. of a cock; as <hi rend="ital">a cognomen of</hi> Antonius Primus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bechicus: <entryFree id="n5096" type="greek" key="be_chi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēchĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bhxiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for a cough</hi> (pure Lat. tussicularis): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:17:172" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 17, 172</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bechion: <entryFree id="n5097" type="greek" key="be_chi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēchĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bh/xion</foreign>, <sense id="n5097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant good for a cough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colt</hi>'<hi rend="ital">sfoot</hi>: Tussilago farfara, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 6, 16, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bechires: <entryFree id="n5098" type="main" key="Be^chi_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕchīres</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕchīri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 945</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕchēri</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 11</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*be/xeires</foreign>, <sense id="n5098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian people on the Pontus Euxinus;</hi> perh. kindr. with the modern Bashkirs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 3, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bedesis: <entryFree id="n5099" type="main" key="Bede^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bedĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, now <hi rend="ital">Bedese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bedriacum: <entryFree id="n5100" type="main" key="Be_dri^a^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēdrĭăcum</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēbrĭăcum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bētrĭăcum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bhtri/akon</foreign>, <sense id="n5100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in Upper Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Verona and Cremona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished in the civil war by two important battles between Otho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vitellius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the generals of Vespasian</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cividale;</hi> form Bedriacum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23:39 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 23, 39 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 49</bibl>; 2, 3, 15; 2, 3, 20; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 31.—Form Bebriacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 8</bibl>.—Form Betriacum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēdrĭăcensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Bētrĭ-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bedriacum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; 3, 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae et duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 69, § 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bee: <entryFree id="n5101" type="main" key="bee"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bee</orth>, <sense id="n5101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sound made by a sheep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; cf. balo.</sense></entryFree>
beelzebub: <entryFree id="n5102" type="main" key="Beelze^bu^b"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Beelzĕbŭb</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Beelzĕbŭl</orth>, <itype>ūlis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*beelzebou/b</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*beelzebou/l</foreign>, Heb. <foreign /> or <foreign />; in eccl. Lat. <sense id="n5102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Beelzebub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chief of evil spirits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 26</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 267.</sense></entryFree>
begorrites: <entryFree id="n5103" type="main" key="Begorri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Begorrītes</orth> <itype>lăcus</itype>, <sense id="n5103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Macedonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lake of Kitrine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belbus: <entryFree id="n5104" type="main" key="belbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">belbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = hyaena, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. III. 33, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
belena: <entryFree id="n5105" type="main" key="Belena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Belena</orth> = Helena, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 15</bibl>.</entryFree>
belenus: <entryFree id="n5106" type="gloss" key="Belenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Belenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity worshipped in Noricum and Aquileia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Nat. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 823</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1967</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belgae: <entryFree id="n5107" type="main" key="Belgae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Belgae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*be/lgai</foreign> [Balge, in Lower Germany, a low, swampy region], <sense id="n5107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Belgians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a warlike people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of German and Celtic origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the north of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 76 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bel-ga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Belgian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 426</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 226</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5107.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Belgĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Belgic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esseda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 18, 26: <cit><quote lang="la">calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 65, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 80</bibl></cit>.—Hence, Gallia Belgica, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Belgica, <hi rend="ital">the northern part of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Seine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Marne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the North Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabited by the Belgians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 16, 17, § 76</bibl>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 58 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
belgium: <entryFree id="n5108" type="main" key="Belgi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Belgĭum</orth>. <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">on both sides of the Somme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">including the Belloraci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Atrebates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Ambiani</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25</bibl>; 8, 46.</sense></entryFree>
belial: <entryFree id="n5109" type="main" key="Beli^al"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Belĭal</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Belĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>), = Heb. <foreign />, <sense id="n5109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Belial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chief of the evil spirits</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 714</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 13, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belias: <entryFree id="n5110" type="main" key="Belias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Belias</orth>, v. Belial and Belus.</entryFree>
belides: <entryFree id="n5111" type="main" key="Belides"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Belides</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Belis</orth>, v. Belus. <cb n="BELL" /></entryFree>
belion: <entryFree id="n5112" type="main" key="beli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">belĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, the same as po lion, q. v., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellaria: <entryFree id="n5113" type="main" key="bella_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is used as a dessert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nuts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confectionery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweet wine</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">the dessert</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">tra/ghma</foreign>, Fr. dragée [from bellus, like bellissimum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 51</bibl> Don., and pulchralia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=210" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 210</bibl>], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl>.!*? Here the corrupted passage ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll. seems to belong: bellarium et bellaria res aptas bellis (epulis? acc. to Scal., or belle? Cod. Ber. and Lips. have belli) appellabant.</sense></entryFree>
bellator: <entryFree id="n5114" type="main" key="bella_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (ancient form <orth extent="full" lang="la">duellā-tor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 68</bibl>; cf. the letter B), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bello</etym>. <sense id="n5114.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A warrior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldier</hi> (as capable of fighting, while miles signifies a soldier by profession; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): domi bellique duellatores optimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu ad legionem bellator clues, at ego in culinā Ares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 68</bibl>;
