<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:23:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 23, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est, qui aut bellatori, aut imperatori, aut oratori quaerat aliquid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 19, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecqua pacifica persona desideretur an in bellatore sint omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo Sulla dissimilis fuit bellator ac victor, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:25:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus bellator duxque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes (opp. otiosi urbani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 26, 13</bibl>; 1, 59, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 359</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:168" default="NO">13, 168</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Stil. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 3, 2 al.</bibl>—Humorously of champion drinkers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5114.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. (like amator, arator, venator, etc.; v. Zumpt, Gr. § 102; in close apposition with another <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, and taking the place of an <pos>adj.</pos>), <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready to fight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">martial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valorous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">bellator Turnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellator deus,</quote> <trans><tr>the war-god Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 721</bibl></cit>.—So esp. freq. equus, <hi rend="ital">a spirited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mettlesome horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 891</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:385" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 385</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feroci Bellatore sedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:127" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:603" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 603</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <trans><tr>the field of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:378" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:376" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 376</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of a stone used in play,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 359</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bellatorius: <entryFree id="n5115" type="main" key="bella_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bellator</etym>, <sense id="n5115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">martial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful in warlike expeditions</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: pugnax et quasi bellatorius stilus, <hi rend="ital">a pugnacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polemic style</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellatrix: <entryFree id="n5116" type="main" key="bella_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female warrior;</hi> freq. in close apposition, and taking the place of an <pos>adj.</pos> (cf. bellator, II.), <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled in war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable in war</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n5116.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penthesilea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:321" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:38" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:262" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the elephant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:576" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 576</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5116.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:57" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaeba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>producing warriors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:612" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 2</bibl></cit>: aquilae, <hi rend="ital">ensigns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standards</hi>, id. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 193.—</sense><sense id="n5116.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ista bellatrix iracundia, <hi rend="ital">this warlike rage</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 54</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bellatulus: <entryFree id="n5117" type="hapax" key="bella_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n5117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [bellus] (instead of bellulus for the alliteration), <hi rend="ital">pretty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bella bellatula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bellax: <entryFree id="n5118" type="hapax" key="bellax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bello</etym>, <sense id="n5118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">martial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 406</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1263</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
belle: <entryFree id="n5119" type="main" key="belle_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. bellus <sense id="n5119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bellerophon: <entryFree id="n5120" type="main" key="Belle^ro^pho_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellĕrŏphōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellĕrŏ-phontes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 288</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bellerofw=n</foreign>, Theocr. (regularly formed <foreign lang="greek">*bellerofo/nths</foreign>), <sense id="n5120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Glaucus and grandson of Sisyphus;</hi> he was sent by Prœtus, at the calumnious instigation of his wife Sthenebœa, with a letter to Iobates, in which the latter was requested to put him to death; <cit><quote lang="la">he received from him the commission to slay the Chimæra, which he executed, riding upon the flying Pegasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5</bibl>. 97; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:325" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 325</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:57" default="NO">57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 18</bibl>; Serv. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 1</bibl>.—Prov. for <hi rend="ital">any one who carries a message unfavorable to himself</hi> (cf. Uriah's letter), Plaut. <pb n="226" /> <cb n="BELL" /> Bacch. 4, 7, 12.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5120.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellĕrŏ-phontēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Bellerophon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pegasus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 3, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">habenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 1, 449</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bellicosus: <entryFree id="n5121" type="main" key="belli^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭcōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">duellĭc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bellicus</etym>, <sense id="n5121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">martial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valorous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; usu. of personal subjects; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellicus): gentes immanes et barbarae et bellicosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicosissimae nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2</bibl>. 11, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 3, 57: provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissimus quisque ac bellicosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 15</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 8, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod multo bellicosius erat Romanam virtutem ferociamque cepisse, i. e. fortius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicosior annus,</quote> <trans><tr>a more warlike year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 9, 10</bibl></cit> (cf. the opp. imbellis annus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 4</bibl>).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
bellicrepa: <entryFree id="n5122" type="gloss" key="belli^cre^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭcrĕpa saltātio</orth>, <sense id="n5122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an armed dance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dancing in arms</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll. (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)no/plios o)/rxhsis</foreign>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 105" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 105</bibl> Vahl.</sense></entryFree>
bellicus: <entryFree id="n5123" type="main" key="belli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">duellĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bellum</etym>, <sense id="n5123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">war-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">military.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5123.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n5123.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars duellica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicam rem administrari majores nostri nisi auspicato noluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 36, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus,</quote> <trans><tr>military glory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerimoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:58" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>proceeding from the enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubicen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 15, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 14, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">parma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 25, 8: nomina, <hi rend="ital">appellatives obtained by valorous deeds in war</hi> (as Africanus, Asiaticus, Macedonicus, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <trans><tr>the misfortune of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laus. Seren. 196</bibl></cit>: columella. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl>; cf. Bellona.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a signal for march</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the beginning of an attack</hi> (given by the trumpet); always in the connection bellicum canere, <hi rend="ital">to give the signal for breaking up camp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for commencing hostilities</hi>: Philippum, ubi primum bellicum cani audisset, arma capturum, <hi rend="ital">at the first signal will be ready to take arms</hi>, etc., Liv 35, 18, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque aliqui motus novus bellicum canere coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>causes the war-trumpet to sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15, 11</bibl>; App de Mundo, p. 71, 37.—</sense><sense id="n5123.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: idem bellicum me cecinisse dicunt. <hi rend="ital">aroused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incited</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 3</bibl>.—And of fiery, inflammatory discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">alter (Thucydides) incitatior fertur et de bellicis rebus canit etiam quodammodo bellicum,</quote> <trans><tr>sounds the alarm</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eosdem modos adhibent, cum bellicum est canendum, et cum posito genu supplicandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:33" default="NO">10, 1, 33</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5123.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, = bellicosus, <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce in war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:752" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 752</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:814" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 814</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 754</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Romulus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:478" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted to war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:38:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 38, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: equorum duellica proles, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 661</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellienus: <entryFree id="n5124" type="main" key="Belli^e_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellĭēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5124.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Annius Bellienus, <hi rend="ital">a lieutenant of Fonteius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 8, 18</bibl> (4, 8).—</sense><sense id="n5124.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Bellienus, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>: 16, 22, 2.—</sense><sense id="n5124.3" n="III" level="1"> C. Bellienus, <hi rend="ital">an advocate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:175" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 47, 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellifer: <entryFree id="n5125" type="hapax" key="belli^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bellum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n5125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr, 1, 429</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
belliger: <entryFree id="n5126" type="main" key="belli^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bellum-gero</etym>, <sense id="n5126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">waging war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">martial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valiant</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in the post-Aug. per.): gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:124" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustus, Claud. in Prob. et Olybr Cons. 74: Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:38" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the elephant used in war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:261" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5126.1" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim things: <cit><quote lang="la">manus, Ov A. A. 2, 672 ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:M 3:534" default="NO"><author>id.</author> M 3, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:717" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropaea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens, Sil 3, 162: currus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:617" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons Hon. 621</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
belligerator: <entryFree id="n5127" type="main" key="belli^ge^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭgĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>belligero</etym>, <sense id="n5127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warrior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combatant</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cb n="BELL" /> Arimaspae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 55</bibl>; Ven. Vit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:370" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 370</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 15, 13</bibl>; 16, 4.</sense></entryFree>
belligero: <entryFree id="n5128" type="main" key="belli^ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭgĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭ-gĕror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 274" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 274 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>) [bellum-gero], <sense id="n5128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry on war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fight</hi> (very rare): nec cauponantes bellum, sed belligerantes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 201 Vahl.); Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam belligerant Aetoli cum Aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 67</bibl>: excitandus nobis erit ab inferis quoniam nobis non solum cum his... sed etiam cum fortunā belligerandum fuit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Quir. 8, 19</bibl> (but ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 16, 36</bibl>, the true read. is in bello gerendo, B. and K.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Gallis tumultuatum verius quam belligeratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversum accolas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5128.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Geniis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Quir. 8, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
belligeror: <entryFree id="n5129" type="main" key="bellige^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">belligĕror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. belligero <sense id="n5129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bellio: <entryFree id="n5130" type="main" key="belli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the yellow ox-eye daisy</hi>: Chrysanthemum segetum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 25, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellipotens: <entryFree id="n5131" type="main" key="belli^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bellum - potens</etym>, <sense id="n5131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mighty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">valiant in war</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): bellipotentes sunt magis quam sapientipotentes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl> (Ann. v. 188 Vahl.).—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bellipotens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:715" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 715</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:529" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 529</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laus Seren. 40</bibl>; Tert. cont. Jud. 9; Firm. p. 27.</sense></entryFree>
bellis: <entryFree id="n5132" type="main" key="bellis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the white daisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ox-eye</hi>: Bellis perennis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 5, 13, § 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellisonus: <entryFree id="n5133" type="hapax" key="belli^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bellum-sono</etym>, <sense id="n5133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding of war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Natal. S. Fel. 8, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
bellitudo: <entryFree id="n5134" type="gloss" key="belli^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bellus</etym>, <sense id="n5134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loveliness</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
bellius: <entryFree id="n5135" type="main" key="Belli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shortened form of the name Duellius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bello: <entryFree id="n5136" type="main" key="bello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bello</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>bellum</etym>. <sense id="n5136.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to wage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry on war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fight in war</hi> (class.; cf.: milito, proelior). </sense><sense id="n5136.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit proprium populi Romani longe a domo bellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines bellandi cupidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana arma primum Claudio principo in Mauretaniā bellavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verens, ne bellare perseveraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius bellare destitit, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 61: populus jam octingesimum bellans annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 47, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:10" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 59, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellante prior, jacentem Lenis in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:51" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellandum profecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5136.2" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5136.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Poenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 4, 33, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Ennio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timol. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 41, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 12, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5136.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adversum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversum patrem tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus Gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5136.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">has contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:373" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 373</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5136.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eo olim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5136.7" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro Samnitibus adversus Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5136.8" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5136.9" n="C" level="2"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">polemei=n tini</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">magno parenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:506" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 506</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:503" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 503</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5136.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in Italiā bellabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellatum cum Gallis eo anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5136.11" n="E" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">po/lemon polemei=n</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc bellum a consulibus bellatum quidam auctores sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>conducted by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39, 16</bibl></cit> (8, 40, 1). —</sense><sense id="n5136.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to fight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quoniam prohibent anni bellare, loquendo Pugnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 101</bibl></cit>.—Esp., with <case>abl.</case> of weapon, etc. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:235" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:498" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec caestu bellare minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:829" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 829</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. 1, 30</bibl>; cf. bellor</sense></entryFree>
bellocassi: <entryFree id="n5137" type="main" key="Bellocassi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellocassi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Velocasses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. G 2, 4</bibl>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Velliocasses</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 7</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the right bank of the Seine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the mouth of the Oise to the town Le Pont de l</hi>'<hi rend="ital">Arche</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl></sense></entryFree>
bellona: <entryFree id="n5138" type="main" key="Bello_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellōna</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Duellōna</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 49</bibl> Müll., and the letter B), ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Bellona a bello nunc, quae Duellona a duello, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 73</bibl> Müll.</etym>: <foreign lang="greek">'*enuw/, '*erinnu/s, qea\ polemikh/</foreign>, Gloss., <sense id="n5138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of</hi> <cb n="BELL" /> <hi rend="ital">war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Mars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose temple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by Appius Claudius Cœcus</hi> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 539</bibl>). <hi rend="ital">in the ninth district of the city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was situated not far from the Circus Maximus</hi>, Publ. Vict. Descr. Urb.—<hi rend="ital">A place of assemblage for the Senate for proceedings with persons who were not allowed entrance into the city</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 21, 12 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 703</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 223</bibl>: Bellona dicebatur dea bellorum, ante cujus templum erat columella, quae Bellica vocabatur, super quam hastam jaciebant, cum bellum indicebatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=33" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 33</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:201 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 201 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 53</bibl>: cos. SENATVM. CONSOLVERVNT. N. OCTOB. APVD. AEDEM. DVELONAI., S. C. Bacch., v. Append.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1313" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1313</bibl>; Claud. in Prob. et Olybr. Cons. 121; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:in Ruf. 1:342" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Ruf. 1, 342</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:263" default="NO">2, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:IV. Cons. Hon. 12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 314</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 371</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Get. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">466</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 124, 256</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1903</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2316</bibl>. Her priests (turba entheata Bellonae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 57, 11</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellōnārii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 223</bibl> dub.) and priestesses were accustomed, in their mystic festivals. especially on the 20th of March (hence dies sanguinis, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2318</bibl>), to gash their arms and shoulders with knives, and thus to offer their blood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:45 sq" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 45 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 565</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 30, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellonaria: <entryFree id="n5139" type="main" key="bello_na_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellōnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> solanum, <hi rend="ital">used by the priests at the festival of Bellona</hi> (v. Bellona), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellonarii: <entryFree id="n5140" type="main" key="Bello_na_rii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellōnārii</orth>, v. Bellona.</entryFree>
bellor: <entryFree id="n5141" type="main" key="bellor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <sense id="n5141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> (collat. form of bello), <hi rend="ital">to carry on war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fight</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">et pictis bellantur Amazones armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nudis bellantur equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:349" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 349</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 472, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, 4, 24, p. 796</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
bellosus: <entryFree id="n5142" type="hapax" key="bello_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bellum</etym>, <sense id="n5142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>: genus, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 80, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellovaci: <entryFree id="n5143" type="main" key="Bello^va^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bellŏvăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*belloa/koi</foreign>, Strab.; <foreign lang="greek">*bellou/akoi</foreign>, Ptol., <sense id="n5143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">in the modern Beauvais</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 59</bibl>; 7, 75; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:8:14" default="NO">8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bellua: <entryFree id="n5144" type="main" key="bellua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellua, bellualis, -ilis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-inus</orth>, v. belua, etc.</entryFree>
bellule: <entryFree id="n5145" type="main" key="bellu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. bellulus <sense id="n5145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bellulus: <entryFree id="n5146" type="main" key="bellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n5146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [bellus], <hi rend="ital">pretty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi> (ante- and post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">edepol haec quidem bellula est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1514, 3</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bellŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">prettily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finely</hi>, etc., Plaut. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=36" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 36</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 272, 34.</sense></entryFree>
bellum: <entryFree id="n5147" type="main" key="bellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellum</orth> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> <orth extent="full" lang="la">duel-lum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. dva, dvi, dus; cf. Germ. zwei; Engl. two, twice; for the change from initial du- to b-, cf. bis for duis, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">B</ref></xr>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 73</bibl> Müll.; 7, § 49 ib.</etym>, <sense id="n5147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">war.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5147.1" n="I" level="1"> Form duellum: duellum, bellum, videlicet quod duabus partibus de victoriā contendentibus dimicatur. Inde est perduellis, qui pertinaciter retinet bellum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66, 17</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum antea duellum vocatum eo quod duae sunt dimicantium partes ... Postea mutatā litterā dictum bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: hos pestis necuit, pars occidit illa duellis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 9, 861</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 549 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">legiones reveniunt domum Exstincto duello maximo atque internecatis hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae domi duellique male fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—So in archaic style, or in citations from ancient documents: <cit><quote lang="la">quique agent rem duelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes atque ferrum, duelli instrumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit> (translated from the Platonic laws): <cit><quote lang="la">puro pioque duello quaerendas (res) censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 12</bibl></cit> (quoted from ancient transactions); so, <cit><quote lang="la">quod duellum populo Romano cum Carthaginiensi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriaque duelli populi Romani erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si duellum quod cum rege Antiocho sumi populus jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and from an ancient inscription' duello magno dirimendo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 52, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic... Pacem duello miscuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadum Marsi memorem duelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuum duellis Janum Quirini clausit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 254</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:201" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 169</bibl>— <pb n="227" /> <cb n="BELL" /> </sense><sense id="n5147.2" n="II" level="1"> Form bellum. </sense><sense id="n5147.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">War</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warfare</hi> (abstr.), or <hi rend="ital">a war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the war</hi> (concr.), i.e. <hi rend="ital">hostilities between two nations</hi> (cf. tumultus). </sense><sense id="n5147.4" n="1" level="3"> Specifying the enemy. </sense><sense id="n5147.5" n="a" level="4"> By <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> denoting the nation: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus Punicis Siciliensibusque bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:47:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 47, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot annis ante secundum Punicum bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannicum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:46:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 46, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: bellum piraticum,</quote> <trans><tr>the war against the pirates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 1</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes the <pos>adj.</pos> refers to the leader or king of the enemy: <cit><quote lang="la">Sertorianum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridaticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurthinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: bellum regium,</quote> <trans><tr>the war against kings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 50</bibl></cit>. —Or it refers to the theatre of the war: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Africanum, Transalpinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiaticum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Actiacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 86, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispaniense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 55, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.6" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the name of the nation or its leader: bellum Latinorum, <hi rend="ital">the Latin war</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">against the Latins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venetorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 30: Ambiorigis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrhi, Philippi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.7" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case> of the name. </sense><sense id="n5147.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Attributively: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Jugurthā, cum Cimbris, cum Teutonis bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:20:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli causā cum Samnitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc finem bellum cum Philippo habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 35, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum cum Antiocho instabat bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 36, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:58:8" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 58, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 1, 8</bibl>; 44, 14, 7.—</sense><sense id="n5147.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> dependent on the verb: <cit><quote lang="la">quia bellum Aetolis esse dixi cum Aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi consules... duo bella habuere... alterum cum Tiburtibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; esp. with gero, v. 2. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> infra.—</sense><sense id="n5147.10" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi> and <case>acc.</case> of the name. </sense><sense id="n5147.11" n="(a)" level="5"> Attributively: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum adversus Philippum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum populus adversus Vestinos jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 29, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi> dependent on the verb: quod homines populi Hermunduli adversus populum Romanum bellum fecere, Cincius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 14, 1</bibl>: nos pro vobis bellum suscepimus adversus Philippum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 31, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut multo acrius adversus duos quam adversus unum pararet bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum quod rex adversus Datamem susceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.13" n="e" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bellum nefarium contra aras et focos, contra vitam fortunasque nostras... non comparari, sed geri jam viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam belli contra patriam inferendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.14" n="f" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses in Peloponnesios sexto et vicesimo anno bellum gerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.15" n="g" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic finis belli inter Romanos ac Persea fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.16" n="h" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secutum est bellum gestum apud Mutinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.17" n="k" level="4"> With <case>dat.</case> of the enemy after inferre and facere, v. 2. a. <foreign lang="greek">k</foreign> infra.—</sense><sense id="n5147.18" n="2" level="3"> With verbs. </sense><sense id="n5147.19" n="a" level="4"> Referring to the beginning of the war. </sense><sense id="n5147.20" n="(a)" level="5"> Bellum movere or commovere, <hi rend="ital">to bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir up a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa erat observatio in bello movendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum commotum a Scapulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiabant alii... in Apuliā servile bellum moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is primum Volscis bellum in ducentos amplius... annos movit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insequenti anno Veiens bellum motum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 58, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii pium movere bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 627</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 509</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 27, 5</bibl></cit>; and ciere (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 541</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 829</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 158</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.21" n="(b)" level="5"> Bellum parare, comparare, apparare, or se praeparare bello, <hi rend="ital">to prepare a war</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">for a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tam pestiferum bellum pararet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum utrimque summopere parabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 11, 8</bibl> (v. II. A. 1. d. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> supra); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 456</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">parare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum terrā et mari comparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum bellum ... Cn. Pompeius extremā hieme apparavit, ineunte vere suscepit, mediā aestate confecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum omnium consensu apparari coeptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam imperator ita paci credit, ut non se praeparet bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.22" n="(g)" level="5"> Bellum differre, <hi rend="ital">to postpone a</hi> <cb n="BELL" /> <hi rend="ital">war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam poterat bellum differri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors Hamilcaris et pueritia Hannibalis distulerunt bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.23" n="(d)" level="5"> Bellum sumere, <hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin a war</hi> (not in Cæsar): <cit><quote lang="la">omne bellum sumi facile, ceterum aegerrume desinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius tamen omnia pati decrevit quam bellum sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de integro bellum sumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 62, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis haec maxima ratio belli sumendi fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumi bellum etiam ab ignavis, strenuissimi cujusque periculo geri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 5</bibl>; 15, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 16</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Bellum suscipere (rarely inire), <hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence a war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join in a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum ita suscipiatur ut nihil nisi pax quaesita videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipienda quidem bella sunt ob eam causam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicavit a plerisque ignoratione... bellum esse susceptum,</quote> <trans><tr>join</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl> (v. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">cum avertisset plebem a suscipiendo bello,</quote> <trans><tr>undertaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatui cum Camillo agi placuit ut bellum Etruscum susciperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella non causis inita, sed ut eorum merces fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Bellum consentire = bellum consensu decernere, <hi rend="ital">to decree a war by agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ratify a declaration of war</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">consensit et senatus bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum erat consensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32, 12</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Bellum alicui mandare, committere, decernere, dare, gerendum dare, ad aliquem deferre, or aliquem bello praeficere, praeponere, <hi rend="ital">to assign a war to one as a commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give one the chief command in a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ne tum quidem populus Romanus ad privatum detulit bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus consuli... bellum gerendum dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non... eidem ... hoc quoque bellum regium committamus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camillus cui id bellum mandatum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volscum bellum M. Furio extra ordinem decretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallicum bellum Popilio extra ordinem datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo die a vobis maritimo bello praepositus est imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei (bello) imperatorem praeficere possitis, in quo sit eximia belli scientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc toti bello praefecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui bellum suscipiendum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:19:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 19, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum administrandum permittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 61</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Bellum indicere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to declare war against</hi> (the regular expression; coupled with facere in the ancient formula of the pater patratus), also bellum denuntiare: ob eam rem ego... populo Hermundulo... bellum (in)dico facioque, Cincius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob eam rem ego populusque Romanus populis... Latinis bellum indico facioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthiis bellum indicamus an non?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo intellegi potest, nullum bellum esse justum nisi quod aut rebus repetitis geratur, aut denuntiatum ante sit et indictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:23:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 23, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum indici posse existimabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni reddantur (res) bellum indicere jussos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut... nec gererentur solum sed etiam indicerentur bella aliquo ritu, jus ... descripsit quo res repetuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 18, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 616</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) Bellum inferre alicui (cf. contra aliquem, 1. e. supra; also bellum facere; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>), <hi rend="ital">to begin a war against</hi> (<hi rend="ital">with</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to make war on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Denseletis nefarium bellum intulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei civitati bellum indici atque inferri solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:31:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 31, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi Galliaeque bellum intulissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 248</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellumne populo Romano Lampsacena civitas facere conabatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:31:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 31, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum patriae faciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem Eburonum populo Romano bellum facere ausam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 29: constituit bellum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 26, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupant bellum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>they are the first to begin the war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bellum cum Priscis Latinis fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Palaepolitanis bellum fieri jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 22, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 2, 1</bibl>.— Coupled with instruere, <hi rend="ital">to sustain a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs quae bellum facere atque instruere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 77</bibl></cit>.—Bellum facere had become obsolete at Seneca's time, Sen. <cb n="BELL" /> Ep. 114, 17.—（<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) Bellum oritur or exoritur, <hi rend="ital">a war begins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito bellum in Galliā ex, ortum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud multo propius bellum ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veiens bellum exortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 53, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.24" n="b" level="4"> Referring to the carrying on of the war: bellum gerere, <hi rend="ital">to carry on a war; absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">per</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum gerere in aliquem, 1. a. and f. supra): nisi forte ego vobis... cessare nunc videor cum bella non gero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Celtiberis, cum Cimbris bellum ut cum inimicis gerebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei bellum ut cum rege Perse gereret obtigisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant hae difficultates belli gerendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum cum Germanis gerere constituit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn.
