Pompeius in extremis terris bellum gerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum quod Hannibale duce Carthaginienses cum populo Romano gessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter consul in Sabinis bellum gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 62, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de exercitibus per quos id bellum gereretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chabrias bella in Aegypto suā sponte gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr, 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes bellum administrare only of the commander, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 2, 1</bibl>. —Also (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum bellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 40, 1</bibl></cit> (but belligerantes is <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; Ann. v. 201 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense: bellum agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8, 3</bibl></cit>. —As a synonym: <cit><quote lang="la">bello persequi aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 25, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.25" n="(b)" level="5"> Trahere or ducere bellum, <hi rend="ital">to protract a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est enim aut trahi id bellum, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum trahi non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli trahendi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morae quā trahebant bellum paenitebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadere institui ut bellum duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum enim ducetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 8, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: cum his molliter et per dilationes bellum geri oportet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.26" n="(g)" level="5"> Bellum repellere, defendere, or propulsare, <hi rend="ital">to ward off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self against a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Gallicum C. Caesare imperatore gestum est, antea tantummodo repulsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bellum non intulerit sed defenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnitium vix a se ipsis eo tempore propulsantium bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.27" n="c" level="4"> Referring to the end of a war. </sense><sense id="n5147.28" n="(a)" level="5"> Bellum deponere, ponere, or omittere, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discontinue a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (i.e. bello) et gerendo et deponendo jus ut plurimum valeret lege sanximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bellum) cum deponi victores velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum decem ferme annis ante depositum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos depositum a vobis bellum et ipsi omisimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 31, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit posse condicionibus bellum poni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 112, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum grave cum Etruriā positum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 9</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">velut posito bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manere bellum quod positum simuletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 53, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posito ubique bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 291</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omisso Romano bello Porsinna filium Arruntem Ariciam... mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.29" n="(b)" level="5"> Bellum componere, <hi rend="ital">to end a war by agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make peace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timerent ne bellum componeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bellum compositum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli componendi licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 103:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 103, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 109</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: bellum sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.30" n="(g)" level="5"> Bellum conficere, perficere, finire, <hi rend="ital">to finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end a war;</hi> conficere (the most usual term) and perficere, = <hi rend="ital">to finish a war by conquering;</hi> finire (rare), without implying success: <cit><quote lang="la">is bellum confecerit qui Antonium oppresserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellumque maximum conficies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confecto Mithridatico bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo proelio ... bellum Venetorum confectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30</bibl>; 1, 44; 1, 54; 3, 28; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 16: bello confecto de Rhodiis consultum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:114:3" default="NO" valid="yes">114, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem nisi bello confecto pecuniam petiturum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 40, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 47, 4</bibl>; 32, 32, 6; <cit><quote lang="la">36, 2, 3: bello perfecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se quo die hostem vidisset perfecturum (i. e. bellum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 4, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque desiturum ante... quam finitum aliquā tolerabili condicione bellum videro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: finito ex maximā parte.. <pb n="228" /> <cb n="BELL" /> italico bello, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:8" default="NO">24, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.31" n="d" level="4"> Less usual connections: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum delere: non modo praesentia sed etiam futura bella delevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alere ac fovere bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum navare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 682</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam celeriter belli impetus navigavit ( = quam celeriter navale bellum gestum est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum ascendit in rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum serpit in proximos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.32" n="3" level="3"> As object denoting place or time. </sense><sense id="n5147.33" n="a" level="4"> Proficisci ad bellum, <hi rend="ital">to depart for the war.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5147.34" n="(a)" level="5"> Of the commander: <cit><quote lang="la">consul sortitu ad bellum profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ad bellum Ambiorigis profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut duo ex tribunis ad bellum proficiscerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 45, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 96</bibl> Dietsch. —Post-class.: <cit><quote lang="la">in bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.35" n="(b)" level="5"> Of persons partaking in a war: <cit><quote lang="la">si proficiscerer ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5147.36" n="b" level="4"> Ad bellum mittere, of the commander, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.37" n="c" level="4"> In bella ruere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 782</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bella sequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 547</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.38" n="d" level="4"> Of time. </sense><sense id="n5147.39" n="(a)" level="5"> In the locative case belli, <hi rend="ital">in war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during war;</hi> generally with domi ( = domi militiaeque): <cit><quote lang="la">valete, judices justissimi, domi bellique duellatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">domi duellique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit> (v. I. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscunque rebus vel belli vel domi poterunt rem publicam augeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucorum arbitrio belli domique agitabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus belli ingens, domi modicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 63, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 36, 6</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 43, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bello domique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 34, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi belloque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 26, 21</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">neque bello, neque domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 35, 3</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">domi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul rem et gloriam armis belli repperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit> (where belli may be taken with gloriam; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Wagn. ad loc.): magnae res temporibus illis a fortissimis viris... belli gerebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.40" n="(b)" level="5"> In bello or in bellis, <hi rend="ital">during war</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the wars;</hi> with <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec quae in civili bello fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso bello eadem sensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Volsco bello virtus enituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Punicis bellis, Plin.8, 14, 14, § 37: in bello Trojano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—Without <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fit in bello, capitur alter filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in bello occiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in bello saepius vindicatum est in eos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in bello solum, sed etiam in pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bello parta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:28" default="NO">12, 1, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.41" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> bello or bellis = in bello or in bellis (freq.); with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: nos semper omnibus Punicis Siciliensibusque bellis amicitiam fidemque populi Romani secuti sumus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:47:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 47, § 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello Italico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veienti bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domestico bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Volsco, Aurunco Sabinoque militassent bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor tot intra paucos dies bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo bello, multis tamen proeliis victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentiam saepe divi suam declarant, ut et apud Regillum bello Latinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam felicitatem Helvetiorum bello esse perspectam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—Without attrib.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui etiam bello victis regibus regna reddere consuevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res pace belloque gestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregieque rebus bello gestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 33, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 12, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi bello voti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps pace belloque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cotyn bello juvisse Persea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello parta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.42" n="(d)" level="5"> Inter bellum (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus originis morem necesse est... inter bellum natum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter haec bella consules... facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 63, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.43" n="4" level="3"> Bellum in attributive connection. </sense><sense id="n5147.44" n="a" level="4"> Justum bellum. </sense><sense id="n5147.45" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A righteous war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl> (v. II. A. 2. a. <foreign lang="greek">q</foreign> supra): <cit><quote lang="la">justum piumque bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non loquor apud recusantem justa bella populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 58</bibl>; cf.: illa injusta sunt bella quae sine causā suscepta <cb n="BELL" /> sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:23:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 23, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.46" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A regular war</hi> (opp. a raid, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">in fines Romanos excucurrerunt, populabundi magis quam justi more belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.47" n="b" level="4"> For the different kinds of war: domesticum, civile, intestinum, externum, navale, maritimum, terrā marique gestum, servile, sociale; v. hh. vv.—</sense><sense id="n5147.48" n="c" level="4"> Belli eventus or exitus, <hi rend="ital">the result of a war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicunque belli eventus fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud sane alio animo belli eventum exspectabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus tamen belli minus miserabilem dimicationem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus hujus calamitosissimi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset incertus exitus et anceps fortuna belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8</bibl>, <foreign />: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannici belli exitus exspectatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera bella maximeque Veiens incerti exitus erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.49" n="d" level="4"> Fortuna belli, <hi rend="ital">the chances of war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo varia fortuna belli ancepsque Mars fuit ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 5, 15</bibl> (v. c. supra).—</sense><sense id="n5147.50" n="e" level="4"> Belli artes, <hi rend="ital">military skill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuilibet superiorum regum belli pacisque et artibus et gloriā par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ignotas belli artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperata et belli et pacis artibus erat civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.51" n="f" level="4"> Jus belli, <hi rend="ital">the law of war</hi>: jura belli, <hi rend="ital">the rights</hi> (<hi rend="ital">law</hi>) <hi rend="ital">of war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re publicā maxime servanda sunt jura belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et belli sicut pacis jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure belli res vindicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:94" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.52" n="g" level="4"> Belli duces praestantissimos, <hi rend="ital">the most excellent captains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trium simul bellorum victor,</quote> <trans><tr>a victor in three wars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">victor tot bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27, 1</bibl></cit>). —</sense><sense id="n5147.53" n="h" level="4"> Belli vulnera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 8, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.54" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5147.55" n="1" level="3"> Of things concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui parietibus, qui tectis, qui columnis ac postibus meis... bellum intulistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum contra aras et focos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miror cur philosophiae... bellum indixeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:37:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 37, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventri Indico bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.56" n="2" level="3"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">milvo est quoddam bellum quasi naturale cum corvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc Juno Esse jussit gruem, populisque suis indicere bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.57" n="3" level="3"> With individuals: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi opu'st... cum eis gerere bellum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil turpius quam cum eo bellum gerere quīcum familiariter vixeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi uni cum improbis aeternum videam bellum susceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tibi juventus Romana indicimus bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum testem justo ac pio bello persequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicium domi bellum patres territat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 57</bibl>.—Ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">equus Trojanus qui tot invictos viros muliebre bellum gerentes tulerit ac texerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.58" n="4" level="3"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.59" n="5" level="3"> Personified as god of war ( = Janus): <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas duas quae Belli faciem pictam habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt geminae Belli portae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortiferumque averso in limine Bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 279</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.60" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: bella, <hi rend="ital">army</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">permanet Aonius Nereus violentus in undis, Bellaque non transfert (i.e. Graecorum exercitum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed victae fera bella deae vexere per aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:472" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid faciat bellis obsessus et undis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:490" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 490</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5147.61" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Battle</hi>, = proelium: <cit><quote lang="la">rorarii dicti a rore: qui bellum committebant ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:3:92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in bello saepius vindicatum in eos qui... tardius, revocati, bello excesserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipua laus ejus belli penes consules fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commisso statim bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Actia bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem pugnam, ceu cetera nusquam Bella forent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 439</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1" default="NO">18, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 24, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 98</bibl> (form duellum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 547</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 390</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 633</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:666" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 666</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5147.62" n="8" level="3"> Bellum = liber de bello: <cit><quote lang="la">quam gaudebat Bello suo Punico Naevius!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
belluosus: <entryFree id="n5148" type="main" key="belluo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">belluōsus</orth>, v. beluosus.</entryFree>
bellus: <entryFree id="n5149" type="main" key="bellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>as if for benulus, from benus = bonus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 556</bibl> P.</etym>. <sense id="n5149.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n5149.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">pretty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, etc. (of persons, things, actions, etc.; most freq. in the ante-class. per. and in the poets; in Cic. mostly in his epistt.): uxor, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 248, 17</bibl>: nimis bella es atque<cb n="BELU" />  amabilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 69, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:78:4" default="NO" valid="yes">78, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:65" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:87" default="NO">2, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piliae et puellae Caeciliae bellissimae salutem dices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: fui ego bellus (<hi rend="ital">civil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polite</hi>), lepidus, bonus vir numquam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:78:3" default="NO" valid="yes">78, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:81:2" default="NO" valid="yes">81, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">durius accipere hoc mihi visus est quam homines belli solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo et bellus et humanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero bellissimus tibi salutem plurimam dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, as the effect of health, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac bellus revertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5149.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things, places, etc.: socius es hostibus, socius bellum ita geris, ut bella omnia (<hi rend="ital">every thing beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costly</hi>) domum auferas, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 248, 19</bibl>: unum quicquid, quod quidem erit bellissimum, Carpam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum bellissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis hic bellus atque ut esse maxume optabam locu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum pueris locum esse bellissimum duximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 40, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recordor, quam bella paulisper nobis gubernantibus civitas fuerit,</quote> <trans><tr>in what a pleasant condition the State was</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malae tenebrae Orci, quae omnia bella devoratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidium bellissimum existimo esse senectuti otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(epistula) valde bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio bellissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 25</bibl></cit>: fama, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sit bellum cavere malum,</quote> <trans><tr>how delightful</tr>, <tr>pleasant it is</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 58, 247</bibl></cit>: bellissimum putaverunt dicere amissas (esse litteras), <hi rend="ital">thought it best</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">safest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most plausible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 39</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bella haec pietatis et quaestuosa simulatio,</quote> <trans><tr>fine</tr>, <tr>plausible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi jampridem venit in mentem, bellum esse, aliquo exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 49, 2</bibl>; Cod. 6, 35, 11.—</sense><sense id="n5149.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5149.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gallant</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">illam esse amicam tui viri bellissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallus homo'st bellus: nam dulces jungit amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:78:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 78, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5149.5" n="B" level="2"> For bonus, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>: venio nunc ad alterum genus testamenti, quod dicitur physicon, in quo Graeci belliores quam Romani nostri, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 77, 30</bibl> (Sat. Menipp. 87, 3).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">bellē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">prettily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becomingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightfully</hi>, etc.: quare bene et praeclare, quamvis nobis saepe dicatur; <cit><quote lang="la">belle et festive, nimium saepe nolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 35</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 644</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:48 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 48 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod honeste aut sine detrimento nostro promittere non possumus... belle negandum est,</quote> <trans><tr>in a courtly</tr>, <tr>polite manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 11:45" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 11, 45</bibl></cit>; so Publ. Syr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:14:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 14, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belle se habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: belle habere (cf.: <foreign lang="greek">eu)=, kalw=s e)/xein</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to be in good health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be well</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellissime esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere, in medical lang.,</quote> <trans><tr>to operate well</tr>, <tr>to have a good effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 136" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:150" default="NO">150</bibl> (cf. the uses of bene). —With <hi rend="ital">bellus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">i sane, bella belle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 8, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 35</bibl> (cf.: <foreign lang="greek">kalh\ kalw=s</foreign>, Av. Ach. 253).—Ellipt., belle, for belle habere: sed ut ad epistolas tuas redeam, cetera belle, illud miror, <hi rend="ital">the others are well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa fero equidem fronte, ut puto, et voltu bellissime, sed angor intimis sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 9, 1</bibl></cit> al. (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> perh. not in use).</sense></entryFree>
bellutus: <entryFree id="n5150" type="gloss" key="bellu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bellūtus</orth>, v. belutus.</entryFree>
belluus: <entryFree id="n5151" type="gloss" key="belluus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">belluus</orth>, v. beluus.</entryFree>
belo: <entryFree id="n5152" type="main" key="be_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlo</orth>, v. balo <sense id="n5152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
beloacos: <entryFree id="n5153" type="hapax" key="be^lo^a^co^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕlŏăcŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕlŏtŏcŏs</orth>, <sense id="n5153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> dictamnus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belone: <entryFree id="n5154" type="greek" key="be^lo^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕlŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">belo/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n5154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> acus, <hi rend="ital">hornpike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garfish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 76, § 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belua: <entryFree id="n5155" type="main" key="be_lu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭa</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">bellŭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (belua, dissyl., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 26</bibl>) [perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">qh/r</foreign>, fera, as uber with <foreign lang="greek">ou)=qar</foreign>, and paulus with <foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign>], <sense id="n5155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beast</hi> distinguished for size or ferocity, <hi rend="ital">a monster</hi> (as an elephant, lion, wild boar, whale, etc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestia, fera): elephanto beluarum nulla prudentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea genera beluarum, quae in Rubro Mari Indiāve gignantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulas stellas numeras deos, eosque beluarum nomine appellas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl></cit>, <pb n="229" /> <cb n="BENA" /> 40; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera et immanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasta et immanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centiceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 34 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n5155.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. freq., <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh)n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the elephant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 25</bibl> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam beluarum terror exoleverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. Graev. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:49" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:543" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 543</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis (gladiis) appetebant beluarum manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:33 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 33 al.</bibl></cit> —Hence with the epithets, Inda, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaetula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5155.2" n="II" level="1"> Sometimes, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a beast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animal</hi> (even of small and tame animals): <cit><quote lang="la">quo quidem agno sat scio magis curiosam nusquam esse ullam beluam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">The lower animals</hi>, as distinguished from man: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum natura hominis pecudibus reliquisque beluis antecedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 16</bibl> and 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 47, 122</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5155.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5155.4" n="A" level="2"> As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">beast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brute</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">age nunc, belua, Credis huic quod dicat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid ego hospitii jura in hac immani beluā commemoro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:42:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 42, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beluae quaedam illae immanes ac ferae, forma hominum indutae, exstiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5155.5" n="B" level="2"> Of abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quod, ut feram et inmanem beluam, sic ex animis nostris adsensionem extraxisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos increpans, ut ignaros, quanta belua esset imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia, belua fera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Rep. Ordin. 2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Rep. Ordin. 2, 54</bibl></cit> (p. 274 Gerl.).</sense></entryFree>
belualis: <entryFree id="n5156" type="hapax" key="be_lu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>belua</etym>, <sense id="n5156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brutish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">educatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
beluatus: <entryFree id="n5157" type="hapax" key="be_lu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornamented</hi> or <hi rend="ital">embroidered with figures of animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tapetia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
beluilis: <entryFree id="n5158" type="main" key="be_lu^i_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭīlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brutal</hi> (post-class.): beluile <foreign lang="greek">qhriw=des</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">beluile saevientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:88" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:3:55" default="NO">3, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beluinus: <entryFree id="n5159" type="main" key="be_lu^i_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brutal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:54" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
belunum: <entryFree id="n5160" type="main" key="Be_lu_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital city of a people of Venetia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Belluno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3549</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beluosus: <entryFree id="n5161" type="main" key="be_lu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in beasts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">monsters</hi>: Oceanus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 47</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Ora Marit. 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belus: <entryFree id="n5162" type="main" key="Be_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bh=los</foreign>; Heb. <foreign />. <sense id="n5162.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Asiatic king of a primitive age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">builder of Babylon and founder of the Babylonian kingdom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 621</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 729</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">priscus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 213</bibl></cit> (like <foreign lang="greek">*bh=los o( a)rxai=os</foreign>, Aelian. V. H. 13, 3).—</sense><sense id="n5162.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Indian deity</hi>, compared with Hercules of the Greeks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>; cf. Robinson, Dict., under <foreign />.—</sense><sense id="n5162.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Danaus and Ægyptus.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n5162.3" n="IV" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5162.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (for the length of the <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 584</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bhli/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Belus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belidae fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Danaus and Ægyptus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:291" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surge, age, Belide, de tot modo fratribus unus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Lynceus</tr>, <tr>son of Ægyptus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palamedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit> (septimo gradu a Belo originem ducens, Serv.).—</sense><sense id="n5162.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and usu. in <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlĭdĕs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the granddaughters of Belus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Belides</hi>, = Danaides (v. Danaus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 463</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5162.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = Belis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 961" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 961</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5162.7" n="V" level="1"> Beli oculus, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of onyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 149</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5162.8" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Galilee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Phœnicia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nahr Naaman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belutus: <entryFree id="n5163" type="gloss" key="be_lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um: bestiae similis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=34" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 34</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
beluus: <entryFree id="n5164" type="gloss" key="be_lu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, = beluinus, Gloss. Isid.</entryFree>
bembinadia: <entryFree id="n5165" type="main" key="Bembinadi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bembinadĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
benacus: <entryFree id="n5166" type="main" key="Be_na_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēnācus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bh/vakos</foreign>, Strabo: lacus, <sense id="n5166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deep and rough lake in</hi> Gallia Transpadana, <hi rend="ital">near Verona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through which the Mincius</hi> (Mincio) <hi rend="ital">flows</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Garda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 22, 38, § 75</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Benacus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 205</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēnācenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people</hi> <cb n="BENE" /> <hi rend="ital">dwelling near Lake Benacus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 260, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bendidius: <entryFree id="n5167" type="main" key="Bendi^di_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bendĭdīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bendi/deios</foreign>, <sense id="n5167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Bendis</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*be/ndis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Thracian Diana</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goddess of the moon</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 41, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bene: <entryFree id="n5168" type="main" key="be^ne^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> of manner and intensity [bonus; the first vowel assimilated to the <sense id="n5168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">e</hi> of the foll. syllable; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 366], <hi rend="ital">well</hi> (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> melius, <hi rend="ital">better; sup.</hi> optime [v. bonus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>], <hi rend="ital">best;</hi> often to be rendered by more specific Engl. adverbs). </sense><sense id="n5168.1" n="I" level="1"> As adjunct of verbs. </sense><sense id="n5168.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n5168.3" n="1" level="3"> Of physical or external goodness, usefulness, ornament, and comfort: <cit><quote lang="la">villam rusticam bene aedificatam habere expedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam bonam beneque aedificatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est agrum bene colere? Bene arare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro bene culto nihil potest esse... uberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cocta erit bene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">32 et saep.: te auratam et vestitam bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: ornatus hic satis me condecet? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Optume, <hi rend="ital">it is very becoming</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me bene curatā cute vises,</quote> <trans><tr>well tended</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene olere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene sonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen non inprimis bene habitavit,</quote> <trans><tr>in the very best style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Catone cum quaereretur, quid maxime in re familiari expediret, respondet Bene pascere? Quid secundum? Satis bene pascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:25:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 25, 89</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene cenare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene de rebus domesticis constitutum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be in good circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: rem (i. e. familiarem) bene paratam comitate perdidit,</quote> <trans><tr>well arranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.4" n="2" level="3"> With respect to the mind. </sense><sense id="n5168.5" n="a" level="4"> Perception, knowledge, ability: <cit><quote lang="la">quas tam bene noverat quam paedagogos nostros novimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin melius novi quam te et vidi saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi optime (Bacchus) et saepe vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui optime suos nosse deberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 22</bibl>: satin' haec meministi et tenes? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Melius quam tu qui docuisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eo mihi melius cernere videor quo ab eo proprius absum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hic melius quam ipse illa scire videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 38, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sophocles vel optime scripserit Electram suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatoris ars quia bene navigandi rationem habet,</quote> <trans><tr>of able seamanship</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius in Volscis imperatum est,</quote> <trans><tr>better generalship was displayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil melius quam omnis mundus administratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: de medico bene existimari scribis, <hi rend="ital">that he is well thought</hi> (<hi rend="ital">spoken</hi>) <hi rend="ital">of</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">his ability</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentibus et bene institutis,</quote> <trans><tr>well educated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientibus et bene naturā constitutis,</quote> <trans><tr>endowed with good natural talent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi melius geruntur ea quae consilio geruntur quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>more ably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas bene pictas collocare in bono lumine,</quote> <trans><tr>good paintings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene respondere interrogationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:81" default="NO">6, 3, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.6" n="b" level="4"> Of feeling, judgment, and will: <cit><quote lang="la">similis in utroque nostrum, cum optime sentiremus, error fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>when we had the best intentions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene sentire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene, optime de re publicā sentire,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold sound views on public affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene animatas eas (insulas) confirmavit,</quote> <trans><tr>well disposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei causae quam Pompeius animatus melius quam paratus susceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; so, optime animati, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bene cogitasti aliquando, laudo,</quote> <trans><tr>that you had good intentions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vero bene sperare (i. e. de bello),</quote> <trans><tr>had good hopes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperabis omnia optime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi bene ex animo volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so freq.: bene alicui velle, v. volo: bene aliquid consulere, <hi rend="ital">to plan something well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilando, agendo, bene consulendo prospera omnia cedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia non bene consulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 92, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5168.7" n="c" level="4"> Of morality, honesty, honor, etc. </sense><sense id="n5168.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Bene vivere, or bene beateque vivere ( = <foreign lang="greek">kalw=s ka)gaqw=s</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to lead a moral and happy</hi> <cb n="BENE" /> <hi rend="ital">life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui virtutem habeat, eum nullius rei ad bene vivendum indigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:51:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 51, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dialecticā vestrā nullam esse ad melius vivendum vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ni ita accideret et melius et prudentius viveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl> et saep.
